Also, it introduced her to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo 17 years ago. Since then, Jovita has received 25 loans through this institution. Through her wise investments and a lot of discipline these loans facilitated many of Jovita's successes, including the education of her children and improving her home. Her future goal is to turn her business into a stylish internet cafe, where her customers will be comfortable and able to purchase the items they need. 

With her Kiva loan Jovita will purchase three display cases which will enable her to organize and display her goods in a more orderly manner, thus making more of an impact on her customers and encouraging them to view and buy what is offered. Jovita manages a portfolio of profitable buyers with whom she has agreed payment plans. She also sells her goods for cash, through offering great deals for purchases of larger volumes and in cash.

loans.use: to buy three display cases, so she can organize and exhibit her goods in a more orderly fashion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair treatments, creams, perfumes, and nutritional products.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora. María eso socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi, esta parroquia es muy visita por ser el balcón de la ciudad de donde se puede admirar gran parte de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

La Señora. María tiene 50 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, 6 son casados e independiente, sus tres hijos solteros son de 18, 15 y 12 años de edad, su hija de 18 años estudia en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
Doña María se dedica al bordado, esta actividad la desempeña hace 12 años, trabaja en su casa todos los días y sin un horario fijo, este trabajo lo aprendió gracias a cursos que les dieron en su comunidad. 

En el banco comunal es socia fundadora, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela, e hilos para continuar con el negocio del bordado.

 Su meta es de ampliar mucho más su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Mujer y Fortaleza” (Women and Strength) Communal Bank.  She lives in the outskirts of the Turi parish.  This parish is visited a lot because it is the balcony of the city where you are able to admire a large part of Cuenca.  Its people devote themselves to commerce, raising animals, and farming.  They also work in the city in different business activities.

María, age 50, is married and has nine children.  Six are married and independent.  Her three single sons are 18, 15, and 12.  Her daughter, age 18, attends the university.  Her last two children go to a school in the city.  Her husband is a farmer.  The house they live in is their own.

María devotes herself to embroidery, and she has been doing this for 12 years.  She works in her house every day without a fixed schedule.  She learned this work thanks to courses that were given in her community.

She is a founding member of her communal bank.  She will use the loan to buy fabric and thread in order to continue with her embroidery business.

Her goal is to expand her business a lot.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos la señora Juana, tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos y nos cuenta:

“Nací en la ciudad del Quillabamba, vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde ahora desarrollo mi actividad económica que es la venta de dulces y galletas, Yo vendo de forma ambulatoria en el centro deportivo recreacional “El Bosque” en mi pequeña carretilla”. 

Ya son 14 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Este crédito es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo galletas, caramelos, gaseosas, refrescos, etc. Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes con local propio.
texts.en:
The “Vamos Juntas” (Together) Communal Bank meets every month in the city of Cusco.  This place is known for being a zone with a lot of tourism, its commerce, and for its traditional “Inti Raymi” (Festival of the Sun) festivities.  It is also known because it is where one of the seven wonders of the world, Machupicchu, can be found.

This is where we meet Juana, age 46.  She is in a common-law-marriage, and she has two children.  She tells us, “I was born in the city of Quillabamba.  I live in the city of Cusco, and that is where I now conduct my business activity.  I sell sweets and cookies in an itinerant manner.  I sell at the recreational sporting center, “El Bosque”.  I sell from my little cart.”  

She has been doing this for 14 years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise like cookies, sweets, soft drinks, and refreshments, etc.

Her dream is to have a grocery store with her own location.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like cookies, sweets, soft drinks, and refreshments, etc.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.es: Nilo de 26 años convive con Yova de 28 años, fruto de esta relación tienen un hijo. Viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en el distrito de Sivia. Nilo, es un joven de gran visión y le gusta explorar cosas nuevas. Su primer trabajo fue en la actividad agrícola, específicamente el cultivo y comercialización de piña en el cual viene consolidándose en su localidad. Actualmente, siguen trabajando en la misma actividad pero debido a la calidad de su producto y a un precio competitivo su margen de ventas ha aumentado; La necesidad constante de mejorar la calidad  y aumentar la cantidad de sus productos requiere un mayor esfuerzo. Por ello Nilo trabaja arduamente en compañía de su familia, la cual le brinda su apoyo incondicional, sin embargo durante las temporadas de cosecha tiene a cargo a sus peones para facilitar la extracción de sus productos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que esta comprometido en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. En tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda concretar sus objetivos. Nilo es la persona que siempre esta siempre al tanto de las reuniones de su banco comunal. Con los 1,500 comprará fertilizantes para fertilizar su parcela.
texts.en:
Nilo is 26 years old and lives with Yova, who is 28. They have a son and live in a rented house located in the district of Sivia. Nilo is a young man with a grand vision and likes to explore new things.

His first work was in agriculture, specifically cultivating and commercializing pineapple, which is becoming common in his locality. At present, he still works in the same activity, but due to the quality of his production and its competitive pricing, his sales margin has grown.

The necessity of constantly improving the quality and increasing the quantity of his products requires a ever greater effort. For this, Nilo works arduously in the company of his family, which offers its  unconditional help. Nevertheless, during harvest season he has to use laborers to facilitate the picking of his pineapples.

This is Nilo's first loan with MFP, and he is committed to making the scheduled payments punctually. He hopes for the help of each one of you so that he can realize his objectives. Nilo is the one who is always up to the mark at his communal bank's reunions. With the 1,500 new sols he will buy fertilizers to spread on his parcel of land.

loans.use: buy sacks of fertilizers for his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Rosa Florinda

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa eso socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi, esta parroquia es muy visita por ser el balcón de la ciudad de donde se puede admirar gran parte de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Doña Rosa tiene 42 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos,  4  son mayores de edad, casados, independientes y le ayudan económicamente y sus tres últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión aserrador, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Rosa se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos que aun se encuentran pequeños, como pasa en casa cría cerdos y pollos. También tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles hace 3 años en la que labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 1 año, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.

Su meta es de  mejorar su casa ya que está un poco deteriorada.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa is a member of the "Mujer y Fortaleza" ["Women and Fortitude"] communal bank. She lives on the outskirts of the parish of Turi, which is much-visited for being 'the balcony of the city,' from which you can admire a large part of Cuenca. The people there work in commerce, raise animals, and work in agriculture. Some also work in the city in various capacities.

Ms. Rosa is 42 years old, married, and has had seven children from her relationship. Four of her children are grown, married, independent, and help her economically. Her three youngest children attend a small school in the city. Her husband is a sawyer. They own the house they live in.

Rosa is dedicated to taking care of her children, who are still small, so she stays at the house and raises pigs and chickens. For the last three years, she  has also had a small grocery store where she works every day of the week but without a fixed schedule.
 
She has been a member of the communal bank for one year and she is going to invest her loan in the purchase of staple products to stock her store.

Her goal is to improve her house, as it is a bit deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy staple goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos la señora Marleny, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos y nos cuenta:

“Nací en la ciudad del Quillabamba, ahora vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrollo mi actividad económica que es brindar servicios, Yo hago mantenimiento de computadoras y oficinas”. 

Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Este crédito es para pagar la matrícula de su hijo que está estudiando música.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Vamos Juntas", meaning "Let's Go Together", meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco. It is a place known for being highly touristic and commercial and for the traditional feast of Inti Raymi. It is also here that we find "Machupicchu", one of the Seven Wonders of the World.

Here we meet Marleny. She is 38 years old and she is married common-law. She has three children, and she tells us: 

"I was born in Quillabamba, but today I live in the city of Cusco and it is where I have my business. I am a service provider, and do maintenance services to computers and offices.

She has already been in business for 25 years and it has gone very well thanks to the dedication she invests in her work. This loan is to pay for her son's tuition fees. He is studying music.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. María eso socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi, esta parroquia es muy visita por ser el balcón de la ciudad de donde se puede admirar gran parte de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

La Señora María tiene 30 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 10, 8, 6, 3, 1 año y un bebé de 8 meses de edad, sus tres primeros hijos  estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña María trabaja en un comedor desde 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde y labora de lunes a sábados. En su casa se dedica a la cría pollos y cuyes que es para su consumo y para la venta.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de pollos y en su alimento para continuar con este negocio. 

Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank named "Mujer y Fortaleza", meaning "Woman and Strength". She lives near the Parish of Turi. This Parrish is highly visited for being the lookout of the city. From here you can admire a large part of Cuenca. The people are dedicated to commerce, raising livestock, and to agriculture. They also carry out various businesses in the city. 

Maria is 30 years old, married, and the fruit of her relationship has been her 5 children, aged 10, 8, 6, 3, 1, and an 8-month old baby. Her three eldest children attend primary school in the city. Her husband works in the field of construction as a construction worker. The house in which they live is their own property.

Maria is employed at a restaurant from 8am until 5pm, working from Monday to Saturday. At home she raises poultry and guinea pigs for their own consumption and to sell. 

She has been with her communal bank for 3 years and her new loan will be invested in the purchase of poultry and their feed, to keep up this business.

Her goal is to finish building her house, as some finishes are still required.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and feed.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger de 24 años es soltero y vive en la casa de su madre, en el distrito de Sivia. Roger es un joven emprendedor que estudia antropología en la UNSCH, sin embargo él no pierde el legado que sus queridos padres lo encomendaron de cultivar la tierra y a preservar la naturaleza. Roger tiene una parcela de cacao en la cual durante sus vacaciones invierte su tiempo y dedicación por que es la única fuente que le genera ingreso económico para poder solventar los gastos de la universidad. En los días de clases, quienes se hacen cargo de su parcela de cacao son sus queridos padres y sus hermanos. Roger está feliz con sus estudios y las labores que realiza en su parcela, el sabe que una vez logradas sus metas no les será ajeno a sus queridos padres y hermanos quienes siempre le brindaron su apoyo incondicional. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de todos para concretar sus objetivos, a la vez se compromete a realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para fertilizar su terreno.
texts.en: Roger is 24 years old, single, and he lives in his mother's house located in the district of Sivia. Roger is a young entrepreneur who is studying anthropology the UNSCH. But he has not lost the legacy left by his beloved parents, that of cultivating the land and preserving nature. Roger has a parcel of land of cocoa plants. During his vacation he invests his time and dedication on the land. It is his only source of income which helps him to cover his university expenses. On days when he has class, his beloved parents and his siblings take care of the cocoa plantation. Roger is happy with his studies and with the work he does on his land. He knows that once he attains his goals his parents and his siblings will support him unconditionally, as they always have. This is his first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he hopes to have your support to help him attain his objectives. He is committed to making his loan payments on time. He will invest the 1000 nuevos soles in the purchase of sacks of fertilizers to fertilize his land.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: Valentina de 53 años de edad, es viuda y tiene solo un hijo, con el que vive en el distrito de Pichari. A Valentina, siempre le ha gustado crecer y no quedarse estancada. Desde muy niña le empezó a gustar apoyar a su familia en las labores agrícolas. Ahora ella con visión de futuro  piensa en grande, es por ello, que ella produce y comercializa sus productos como: cacao café, cuando están en su temporada,  Valentina vende sus productos ocasionalmente en su comunidad, pero generalmente los lleva al distrito de Sivia donde puede colocarlos  a un mejor precio. Ella recibe la ayuda de sus padres y su hijo en tiempos de sembrío y cosecha. Su rutina de  trabajo es de lunes a sábado desde las 6:00 AM  hasta las 7:00 PM. En el futuro piensa invertir en una tienda de ropa o de abarrotes por que ya es poco su rendimiento de ella en las labores agrícolas. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Valentina es la más perseverante en su banco comunal. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que solicita ella realizará la limpieza de las malezas de su parcela de cacao, por ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Valentina, 53, is a widow.  She has one son that she lives with in Pichari District.  Valentina has always liked to grow and not be stuck.  Since she was a little girl she started to like helping her family with their farming chores.  Now, she lives looking toward the future and thinking big.  Because of this, she produces and sells products like: cocoa beans and coffee.  When they are in season Valentina sells her products occasionally in her own community but generally takes them to Sivia District to sell them at a better price.  Her parents and son help her during planting and harvesting.  Her work routine is Monday through Saturday from 6am until 7pm.  In the future, she’d like to invest in a clothing store or a grocery store because farming has become less profitable.

This is her second MFP loan so she commits to being very punctual with her installment payments.  Valentina is the most persevering in her communal bank.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to hire laborers to do the weeding of her cocoa bean fields.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter de 28 años convive con Vilma de 26 años, con quien tiene una hermosa hija. Viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Sivia. Durante su adolescencia Walter, se dedicó a la actividad agrícola, ayudando a sus padres en tiempos de cosecha, pero pensó aquello que sus padres le enseñaron, iba a tener continuidad. Por ello que no se arrepiente de nada y se siente feliz debido a que le va muy bien con el trabajo que realiza. En tiempos de cultivo, necesita de trabajadores para que agilicen de manera rápida y oportuna. Su producto lo vende en los Centros de Acopio de Sivia a un precio razonable. Su plan a futuro es comprar terrenos para que siga incursionando en esta misma actividad, y asi darle mayores satisfacciones a su querida familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que el esta comprometido en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Walter es nuevo en su banco comunal por lo que esta agradecido por formar parte de ello. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará una parcela de terreno.
texts.en:
Walter is 28 years old and lives with Vilma who is 26 years old. Together they have a beautiful daughter. They live in their own house in the district of Sivia. When he was a teenager, Walter worked in agriculture, helping his parents during harvest time because he knew that what they taught him would be useful in the future. He does not regret anything and is very happy because this type of work has gone very well for him. 

When he plants his crops, he needs workers to expedite the process. He sells his products at a reasonable price at the markets of Acopio de Sivia. His plan for the future is to buy land in order to expand his work and to be able to take better care of his beloved family. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he is committed to paying it back on time. He is a new member of the community bank and is very grateful to be a part of it. With the $550 he is requesting he will buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda de 36 años de edad, convive con augusto de 41 con quien tiene 3 hermosos hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sta. Rosa Alta del distrito de Sivia. Para Yolanda su único objetivo es: “salir adelante“. Desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar muy arduamente para poder ayudar a sus padres en el gasto familiar.  Ella vendía los productos que cosechaban sus padres y ganaba sus primeras propinas.  Hoy tiene su propio terreno de cultivo, para la producción de Cacao, por el cual agradece profundamente a sus padres por el apoyo y las enseñanzas que le brindaron. Ella aún no se conforma por ello aspira en adquirir un terreno agrícola para poder incrementar su cultivo de cacao y otros productos para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su querido esposo y el de sus hijos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete a realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Yolanda esta feliz con el apoyo que recibe de su banco comunal. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles que solicita, desea adquirir un terreno agrícola.
texts.en: Yolanda is 36 and lives with Augusto who is 41 years old. They have three beautiful children together. They in their own home, located in the Sta Rosa Alta community of Sivia. Yolanda's only goal is to get ahead. She has had to work very hard since she was very young in order to help her parents with household expenses. She used to sell the products that her parents grew and she earned her first tips this way. Now she has her own farmland, where she grows cocoa. She is very grateful to her parents for their support and for everything they taught her. Yolanda would like to buy more farmland in order to increase her production of cocoa and other products. She has the support of her husband and three children. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is committed to repaying her loan on time. Yolanda is very happy with the support she receives from the community bank. With the $550 she plans to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Anais

texts.es: Anaís  de 22 años convive con Leoberto de 24 años, con quien tienen un hijo. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Anaís  viene laborando en este negocio desde muy joven. Siempre trataba de ayudar a sus padres en poner las semillas, y así le quedó la idea de tener su propio terreno de cultivo. Luego tras heredar el terreno de sus padres, se dedico a cultivar cacao y café porque ella cree que son productos que tienen mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional. Ella se levanta muy temprano, para ir a su parcela y darle el cuidado respectivo. Su horario de trabajo es desde las 8:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM, por lo general siempre cuenta con el apoyo de sus peones en temporada de cosecha. El cacao y café los vende en los centros de acopio y en el mercado de su comunidad, por el cual su margen de rentabilidad esta en crecimiento. En el futuro aspira tener su tienda de abarrotes, con la necesidad de poder diversificar su cartera de clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Anaís es la señora que brinda la estabilidad a su banco comunal por tener buenas visiones. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que solicita, realizará la poda de su parcela de cacao, por ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Anaís is 22 and she lives with Leoberto who is 24 years old. They have a child together. They live in their own house in the Pichari distrcit. Anaís has been working in agriculture since she was very young. She used to always help her parents plant their seeds and that's how she got the idea to have her own farmland. After she inherited a piece of land from her parents, she began growing cocoa and coffee because she believes there is a high demand for these products on the national and international level. 

She gets up very early to go to her land and give it the care it needs. Her work hours are form 8:00am until 6:00pm. She generally hires laborers to help out during harvest time. She sells the cocoa and coffee in the center of Acopio and at the market in her community, which is why her profit margin is growing. In the future she would like to have her own grocery store, because she would like to diversify her client base. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she promises to pay it back on time. Anaís brings a lot of stability to her community bank by having really good ideas. With the loan she is requesting, she will hire farmhands to help with the pruning of her cocoa fields.

loans.use: to hire farmhands.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es: Carlota de 30 años de edad, viuda con 4 hijos, vive en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Durante su infancia Carlota, soñaba con un futuro en buenas condiciones económicas, lo que le hizo preguntarse siempre como es que sus vecinos obtenían rápidamente ingresos económicos  satisfactorios. Ella se preguntaba así misma ¿como lo hacen? , ¿Cual es el secreto para vender y ganar más dinero? Por lo que, aún muy joven decidió en abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, donde conoció a su futuro esposo quien terminó siendo su cliente más fiel. Al pasar los años, Carlota junto a su esposo, motivados por el deseo de brindarles a sus queridos hijos una mejor alimentación y vestido, decidieron hacer crecer su tienda  y gracias a su buen trato y entrega en sus actividades obtuvieron mejores ingresos económicos. Carlota está muy feliz con el negocio que posee y ahora sabe que el secreto de todo emprendedor es el buen trato que debe darles a sus clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que ella esta comprometida en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Ella esta a gusto con el trato que le brindan en su banco comunal. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que solicita, incrementara de más productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Carlota, 30, is a widow with three children living in her own house in Pichari District.  During her childhood Carlota dreamt with a future of good economic conditions which led her to wonder how it was that her neighbors were able to obtain satisfactory income quickly.  She would ask herself:  “How do they do it?” “What’s the secret to sell and earn more money?”  Because of this, she decided while still quite young to open a small grocery store which was where she met her future husband who became her most loyal customer.

Carlota and her husband, motivated by the wish to provide their beloved children with better nutrition and clothing, decided to make their store grow and thanks to the good customer service and the dedication they put into their activities they obtained good income.

Carlota is very happy with the business she has and now knows the secret that every entrepreneur knows: you have to give your customers good service.

This is her second MFP loan so she’s committed to pay her installments punctually.  She is happy with the treatment she gets from her communal bank.  She will use the requested 2000 new sol loan to increase the products that stock her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es: Celestina de 30 años de edad, convive con Freddy de 27 años  con quien tiene 2 hijos. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Celestina recuerda que desde su infancia trabajaba en las labores agrícolas. En la chacra de sus  padres, la  mayor parte del tiempo sembraba y cosechaba cacao y café. En aquel tiempo, el cacao tenía una  gran demanda, por lo que decidió empezar a cosechar sus propias plantaciones. Posteriormente, se independizó de sus padres, no sin antes les agradecerles las lecciones de vida que le inculcaron. Actualmente, produce en grandes volúmenes, lo cual le produce una buena rentabilidad. Para ello trata de cuidar su fuente principal de cualquier plaga de insectos. En esta labor normalmente recibe la ayuda de su pareja, pero durante las temporadas de cosecha necesita la ayuda de sus peones,  porque esto le facilita la extracción de su producto con eficiencia y eficaz. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo ella se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Ella es la que siempre brinda buenas ideas en las reuniones de su banco comunal. Con los 2000 nuevos soles ella invertirá en la limpieza de su terreno agrícola, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Celestina, 30, lives with Freddy, 27.  They have two children and live in their own house located in Pichari District.  Celestina recalls that she’s worked in her parents’ fields since childhood most of the time growing cocoa beans and coffee.  In those days, cocoa beans were in very high demand so she decided to start growing her own crops.  Later on, she became independent from her parents not before thanking them for the life lessons they imparted, though.  Currently, she produced large volumes which in turn produce high profits.  Because of this, she strives to protect her main source of income from possible insect infestations.  Her spouse usually helps her in these tasks but during harvest she needs extra help from farm hands because that makes harvesting easier and more efficient.

This is her second MFP loan and she pledges to repay punctually.  She is always offering good ideas at her communal bank’s meetings.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to hire field hands to do the weeding of her fields.

loans.use: to hire field hands.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 28 años de edad, convive con Homer de 30 años con quien tiene 2 hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Inicialmente, Maribel se dedicaba a la venta de abarrotes juntamente con su querido esposo. Actualmente con el dinero ahorrado abrieron un grifo ubicado en una zona estratégica: la vía que une Pichari y Puerto Cocos. Maribel, venden gasolina y petróleo pero desea en el futuro instalar un surtidor de gas (GNV) ya que sus clientes lo requieren y porque ningún grifo del VRAE posee algo similar. Ella está contenta con su negocio ya que le genera buenos ingresos económicos. Este es su segundo crédito por lo que una vez más se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Ella esta contenta por pertenecer a su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son solidarios. Con los 2000 nuevos soles ella invertirá en la compra de más combustible.
texts.en:
Maribel is 28 and she lives with Homer, who is 30. They have two children and they live in their own home, located in the Pichari district. Initially, Maribel and her husband used to sell groceries. With the money they saved, they have now opened a gas station in a very strategic location: the road that connects Pichari and Puerto Cocos. They sell gasoline and petroleum but in the future they would like to install a natural gas pump because their clients need it and because no other gas station in the area has anything similar. 

Maribel is happy with her business because it generates a good income for her. This is her second loan and she promises to re-pay it on time. She is very happy to belong to the communal bank because all the members are so supportive. With this loan, she will buy more fuel for her gas station.

loans.use: to buy more fuel.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia (42 años), casada con Virgilio (43 años), tiene  4 hijos. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Desde hace varios años, Sonia se dedica al negocio de abarrotes en general,  debido a que en su barrio no existía una tienda. Actualmente viene obteniendo buenas ganancias económicas con respecto a años anteriores. Generalmente su horario de trabajo es a partir de las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 8: 00 de la noche, ya que recibe una cantidad considerable de clientes. La ayuda de sus hijos le permite una atención rápida de los clientes. Mayormente ella vende productos de primera necesidad para el hogar, por ello se siente contenta y satisfecha por lo que viene realizando. Su proyecto a futuro es abrir otra tienda  con la finalidad de obtener mejores ingresos económicos para el bienestar de su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Ella está feliz por formar parte de su banco comunal. Con los  2000 nuevos soles que solicita, podrá amueblar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Sonia, 42, is married to Virgilio, 43 and has four children.  They live in their own house located in Pichari District.  For several years now, Sonia has been in the grocery business because her neighborhood did not have a grocery store.  Currently, she’s earning good profits compared to prior years.  

Generally, she starts work at 6am and goes until 8pm since she usually gets quite a large number of customers.  Help from her children allows her to take care of customers quickly.  For the most part, she sells basic need items for the home and she feels satisfied and happy with the work she’s doing.  Her future project is to open another store hoping to earn still better profits for her family’s wellbeing.

This is her second MFP loan so she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She is happy to be part of her communal bank.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to better equip her store.

loans.use: to buy shelving for her store.

loans.name: Barcelyn

texts.en:
Barcelyn is 39 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Barcelyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Barcelyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

Barcelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a home products business in the Philippines.

Alma requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. She has been in this business for 19 years now and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 42 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Cheryl has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Cheryl aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky works hard to support her family. She is married and has a "tricycle" transport business in the Philippines.

Jinky requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase new tools and equipment. She has been in this business for eight years now and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

In the future, Jinky would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 51 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Delia has a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Delia has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana, 43 years old, is a hard-working business woman. She is married and was blessed with four children; two of her children go to school and the other two children are already working and have their own families.

For almost 10 years, Rosana has been running her community-based sari-sari (variety) store and she is able to earn about P 3,000 monthly. Aside from her general store she is also engaged to vending viands and in transportation services. She earns about P 3,000 in vending her viands. 

Rosana uses her profit for her children allowances, school fees, payments on her new acquired motorcycle, and some of the amount is used in buying feed supplies for her pigs. She dreams of expanding her sari-sari store into a mini grocery. Rosana also hopes that she can send her children to higher levels of education. 

Rosana is asking for additional capital in the amount of P 35,000 which will be used in buying groceries such as sugar, shampoo, canned goods, instant noodles, assorted biscuits, raw vegetables, meat and 15 cases of soft drinks. She would be thankful if her loan request is granted.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, sugar, assorted biscuits, and raw vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
At the age of 51, Arceli still works hard for the sustenance of her family. She has three children attending school. Arceli and her husband manage a farming business and usually earn a yield of P 30,000 every crop season (May and November).

The success of her farming business really depends on weather such as typhoons, floods and drought. Every day, she always makes sure that her crops are in good condition to produce a better yield. Income generated from the business goes to school fees, allowances for the children and daily needs at home.

Arceli wants to strengthen her farming business and that is why she is asking for a loan of P 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming to produce a better yield.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
“My earnings from my 'tricycle' passenger transport service are not enough,” Danilo says. He is married, 33 years old, and blessed with three school-aged children. His only wife is a housekeeper and his partner in improving the quality of their family living conditions.

Danilo is a hard-working and dedicated to his work to ensure the essential needs of the family. Because his income in "tricycle" transport is not enough, he decided to put up a hog-raising business.

Danilo is asking for a loan of P 15,000 to buy additional piglets to raise. He will use the loan wisely for the growth of his business. Danilo believes that this loan is a great contribution for a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat is an active and hard-working man. He is married and the father of one child. His wife is a housewife. Shuhrat has worked as a taxi driver for 10 years. He learnt this business from his father because his father worked as a taxi driver. 

Shuhrat tries and works hard in order to make a good profit for his family. Shuhrat would like to get a loan of 5000 TJS for purchasing spare parts for his car in order to give better service for his clients.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Mr. Purevsuren is 52, a father who is trying to raise his own children. He lives with his wife and younger son in a ger--a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent--in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He worked as a driver for many years in a transportation company and in 2006, he started his own transportation business. His daily earning are approximately USD 40 and he and his wife can't put aside any savings. 

Their plan is to educate their younger son in a language school in Korea. But there is a financial problem with paying school fees or other expenses. Purevsuren has a plan to solve this problem by increasing his business income for his son's school payments. This calls for renewing his mini van used for transport.  

Therefore Purevsuren is taking a loan to make repairs or renew his van.

loans.use: To make repairs or renew his van.

loans.name: Tavhida

texts.en:
Tavhida is a hard-working woman. She is married and the loving mother of three children. She is engaged in processing dried fruits. Always she tries to make a good profit and provide her children's needs. 

Tavhida wants to expand her business and increase her working capital. She would like to get a loan of 1200 USD for purchasing dried fruits for sale in order to make a good profit. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy dried fruit for sale.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Growing his business and achieving a better way of living is the greatest dream of Eduardo. He is 49 years old, married with one school-aged child. His wife is a housekeeper.

Eduardo has been running a hog-raising business for over five years. He earns approximately  P 2,000 per head every four months. Eduardo is requesting a loan of P 7,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. 

Eduardo keeps on working hard and improving his strategy in running his business to achieve his dream: a better way of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is married with 11 children. He is 48 years of age and engaged in a hog-raising business. He's been doing this business for 10 years. He will sell the hogs after four months and usually earns P 2,000 per head. Robert's wife is a housekeeper.

Robert wishes to continue sending his six children to school because five have temporarily stopped because of lack of financial status. He believes that through the business, he will sustain the financial needs of his children in school. 

Robert wants to borrow an additional capital amounting P 10,000 to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for their maintenance. He will try his best to achieve his wish and uplift the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and feed for their maintenance.

loans.name: Mehriddin

texts.en:
Mehriddin is married and the father of two children. He sells vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, onions, etc. He purchases his goods from Kistakuz, Istaravshan, Vorukh, and Gonchi reqion and he sells them in the central local market of Isfara city. He has many regular customers. His father has his own truck and he helps for transportation of goods.

 Mehriddin wants to expand his business by buying more vegetables and increase his working capital. For this purpose he requested a loan of 2100 USD. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
At 53, Rodrigo has maintained his hog-raising business for more than 10 years. He is married with three children who all attend school and his wife is a housekeeper. Rodrigo is able to pay the school fees for his children with the profit generated from his business. 

Rodrigo is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase feed for his hogs. In the future, he wants to maintain and expand his business and increase his income so that he can save money to support his children through university.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his hogs

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 35 years old and married with five children, two who are in school and three who are too young for school. Mario finished secondary school but was not able to continue his studies due to the lack of financial means. He works as an electrician and offers his services to community members. Mario repairs damaged electronics such as washing machines, fans, and televisions and he also repairs shoes and umbrellas. Mario has been in business for almost 11 years. He has a lot of customers due his unique set of repair skills. Mario is thankful because the profit that his business generates has provided for the daily needs of his children, providing rice and other necessities.

Mario is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase equipment such as a Nico light and soldering iron for his business and to cover daily business maintenance fees. He will also use his loan to buy a piglet.

loans.use: to buy a light and soldering iron and cover daily business expenses

loans.name: Abdufattoh

texts.en:
Abdufattoh is an active and responsible father with one child. For the past six years, he has sold spare parts in a local market called “Navbahor.” Abdufattoh travels to Istaravshan city to purchase his goods. He has a good deal of experience and his business is stable and generates considerable income for his family to provide for improving living conditions.

Abdufattoh is requesting a loan of 2,100 USD to purchase spare parts to increase his working capital and expand his business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is single and, for the past five years, has run a sari-sari (retail) business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Ma. Cecilia is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy products to sell such as canned goods, biscuits, bread, and other items. In the future, she would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, and bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past eight years, Josephine has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling fish. She has borrowed and repaid 19 previous loans through NWTF. 

Josephine is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell. In the future, she aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Ma.lina

texts.en:
Ma.Lina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall. Ma.Lina has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from farming vegetables.

Ma.Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of 10 children, Mercedes works hard to support her family. She has a jewelry and personal products sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Mercedes is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of jewelry and personal products to sell.

Mercedes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of jewelry and personal products

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 59 years old, married, and lives with seven family members, two of whom work. 

Murad has owned a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, sweets, cheese, and other dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $2200 loan in order to buy two showcases and a generator for his market. He aims to make more money to give him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy two showcases and a generator for his market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more food for use at her restaurant

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old, widowed, and has two children. 

Rose works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell in her store. 

Rose has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending. 

Rose aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom work. 

Hussein has had a car workshop since 2009; he sells motor oil and offers an oil change service. He has good experience in this field, a good reputation, and he is well known in his area. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to pay the annual rent and to buy an air compressor. He aims to make more money so he can improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent and to buy air compressor

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 54 years old and married. He and his wife have been blessed with two children. The eldest is married and working while the youngest is still studying. 

Benjamin is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has managed this kind of business for ten years and is thankful because he is able to sustain his family. His wife helps with planting the rice. 

Benjamin would like to ask for a loan of 30,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to support him in his farming business. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides, as well as to pay for labor. He hopes that he can increase his yield, which would allow him to save money for his security once he is too old to work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married, and has five children. 

Adel has had an auto repair shop since 2004. He has a lot of experience, a deep understanding of local consumers, and is well known in his area. 

He is requesting a $2100 loan to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He aims to make more money to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. Julieta is married and has a vegetable and spice sales business in the Philippines. 

Julieta requested a 20,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell. 

Julieta has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Julieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married, 41 years old, and has four children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Angelina has a food business in the Philippines. Angelina requested a 29,500 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy vegetables, meat and other ingredients for her food business. 

Angelina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Angelina would like to build and expand her business to increase the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat and other ingredients for her food  business

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a hard-working father who aims to improve his family's standard of living and give his children a bright future. He is 43 years old and has three school-aged children. He has been engaged in rice farming for almost 15 years, earning a net income of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. 

To improve his farm's production, he is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and insecticides, as well as to pay for the labor required for rice production. He is hoping that he will obtain a large quantity of rice and increase his income to satisfy his family's needs. 

He believes that he will be successful someday if he continuously strives despite the hardships and difficulties of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides, and to pay for labor required for rice production

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Clara, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 52, married, and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other equipment. 

Rosalinda has been in this business for 18 years. Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Ahmadboy

texts.en:
Ahmadboy is a hard-working man. He is married and the father of four children. He sells food such as pasta, oil, sugar, sweets and also household goods. He has been running this business for two years with the help of his wife. He wants to expand his business and earn more money to meet his family’s needs. Ahmadboy would like to get a loan of $850 for purchasing food for his grocery store.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy food for his store

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby works hard to support her family. She is married and has a electronic repair business in the Philippines, which she has run for 20 years. Ruby has requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment for her electronic repair business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for her electronic repair business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 55 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice and meat vending. Erlinda aspires to save enough to buy more farm land and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her general store

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta is 54 years old, married and has nine children, two of them in school. She is in the business of pig fattening in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in the business for four years, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Benedicta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 43, married with four children, and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory. She has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling cosmetics. Maribel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets and other materials for her fishing business.

Elsa has been in this business for 30 years. Elsa earns more income from raising pigs.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing nets and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Gan-Uchral

texts.en:
Mrs. Gan-Uchral, 32, is a woman who is trying to improve her family's quality of life. She lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is 8 and a pupil of secondary school. And her husband has been a watchman in a private company since last year. 

Gan-Uchral has been running a meat-selling business in a butcher shop for 9 years and she has gained enough experience in this business field. She is a hardworking woman and wakes up at 5 in the morning, then finishes the job at 9 in the evening every day.  

She is planning to expand her business through raising her business trading capital. It is more beneficial to her monthly earnings and family finances. So she is taking a loan to increase her business trading capital by the purchase of wholesale meat. Her next plan is to build her own butcher shop in the backyard of her house.

loans.use: To increase her business trading capital by the purchase of wholesale meat.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita considers the education of her children the best treasure she can give to them because it will not fade away. She is 48 years old and married with four children. Two of them are married; one is working; and one is a college student. 

Estrelita is grateful because her husband helps her in raising their children. She has managed her community-based sari-sari (variety) store for almost 17 years and she earns about 2,500 Philippines pesos monthly. Her husband is a farmer and, at the same time, he operates his transport motorcycle.

In order to increase the volume of stocks in her community-based sari-sari store, Estrelita would like a loan amounting to 35,000 pesos. This will be used to buy different kinds of groceries such as soft drinks, Nescafe, sugar, ingredients and canned goods. She hopes that through this additional capital she requested, she could be able to increase the income she generates and save money for the schooling of her college student.

loans.use: to buy different kind of groceries such as soft drinks, Nescafe, sugar, ingredients and canned goods

loans.name: C5532 Hirwamutegarugori Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 30 years old and is married with seven children  between 8 and 21 years of age.  She is a businesswoman selling products such as sorghum and beans. She is also the leader of this group which is called "HIRWAMUTEGARUGORI". In the local language this means "HAVE CHANCE WOMEN" . She is the second person on the right side.

Jacqueline has four years of experience.  She works from 6am to 6pm every day except on the weekend and she currently employs one person to help her.

Jacqueline and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and earn more profits which will allow them to reinvest in their businesses and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as sorghum and beans for sale

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 41 years old, married with one child. Her husband is a farmer who grows vegetables, corn and rice.
After working abroad for more than two years as a domestic helper, Thelma came back to the Philippines. Her earnings  abroad became the starting capital for a sari-sari store business where she sells spices, breads soft drinks and can goods. 
Now, Thelma has decided to continue her hog raising business which she left when she went abroad. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise for an additional source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy good farm tools, seeds, mulch, manure and to hire workers.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita has been blessed with four children. Three of them are married while the youngest is still studying.

Rosita started her junk shop business with small capital. She buys recycled materials such as empty cans, bottles, scrap metals, galvanized iron, plastic bottles and wares in their community and other nearby villages to increase her profit. She has been running this business for almost four years and she earns about P2500 monthly. She uses her net income for school fees and for their daily needs such as rice and  other ingredients for making meals.

Rosita is applying for a loan amounting to P15,000 to buy recycled materials such as empty bottles, cans, scrap metals, galvanized iron and wares for her junk shop business. She is hoping that she can maintain the business she manages in order to survive and prepare for the future needs of her children by giving them a good education.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials such as empty bottles, cans, scrap metals, galvanized iron and wares for her junk shop business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 59 years old and married with 6 children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Rosalinda has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosalinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Anita is borrowing 11,000 Philippines pesos through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Marve

texts.en:
Marve is 35 years of age, married, and has three children who are currently going to school. He is a farmer working in the Philippines. He engages in agricultural businesses like rice farming and hog raising. His wife is a housekeeper and his partner in managing their furniture business.

Marve is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase feed for the maintenance of his pigs. He will use the loan wisely for the future of his family. He plans to improve his practice in the hog raising business towards growing the business and gaining a higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is 43 years old and lives in Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, has five children and earns a living by selling fish. She has been in this line of work for two years and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for a year and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of sugar, flour, cooking fat and many more.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and lives with six family members, two of whom are working. Alaa has been an owner of a workshop for repairing auto locks since 2007. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

Alaa decided to apply for a $1200 loan in order to purchase a locksmith key machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a locksmith key machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, mulch and good seeds to modernize his farming activity.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora has managed her rice farming business for 30 years. At 49, she is married with four school-aged children. Her husband is her partner in managing their farm business. Aurora also engages in a hog raising business for an additional source of income for the family. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for farming. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her profits because she is now able to apply the exact amount of farm inputs needed in farming.

Through farming and a remittance from her daughter, she is able to send her children to school and fulfill their daily basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for farming.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has one child.

Wissam has owned a store since 2006, selling wheels, tires and cars batteries. He has good experience and a good reputation, and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to make a sliding door and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to make more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga describes herself as hardworking and a patient mother. She is married and 50 years of age. To make a living, she has run a rice farming business for over 22 years. She earns approximately PHP 30,000 (~$750) per crop during the wet season in this type of business for her 2.0 hectare farm. Her husband is a farmer and assists her in managing their farm.

Dominga wants to barrow a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase hybrid seeds to grow. She will also use the loan to buy fertilizers and pay for the laborers in farming.

At present, Dominga also manages her sari-sari (variety) store business where she usually sells breads, drinks, coffee and sugar for an additional source of income for the family. She will do her best in ensuring that her family will not encounter shortage in terms of finances. She is hoping for the success of her businesses soon.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for the laborers in farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more children's shoes for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more electronics to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is the mother of two school-aged children. She is 38 years old and married to a farmer. For the last 14 years, she and her husband have supported their family by growing a large rice crop. They usually earn a profit of PHP 30,000 per crop during the wet season on 1.5 hectares of land. For nine years, Elvira helped support her family by working overseas as a caregiver, but eventually decided it would be better to live at home and help manage the family business. She is applying for a loan for PHP 27,000 to buy supplies for her farm, including fertilizer, seeds, insecticides and herbicides.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her rice farm.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru:
Компания "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" искренне благодарит социальных инвесторов и Фонд Кива за всестороннюю поддержку и помощь в финансировании своих клиентов. Благодаря вашим усилиям, Дамира успешно развивает свой бизнес в торговле, который позволил выплатить первый кредит по линии Кива без просрочек.
Дамира родилась в селе Чалдовар (Панфиловский район, Кыргызская Республика), в котором сейчас и проживает. Ей 58 лет. Она была третьим ребенком в многодетной, малообеспеченной семье. С раннего детства ей пришлось помогать матери по хозяйству, поэтому она закончила всего 7 классов средней школы. В 22 года вышла замуж. Вскоре родился сын, а затем  две дочери. Муж Дамиры в то время начинал заниматься разведением овец, но особого дохода это не приносило. Но для содержания растущей семьи необходим был постоянный заработок. Таким образом, не имея образования и практических знаний, Дамира решила попробовать торговать.
Начинала Дамира, как и многие в ее ситуации, с торговли на рынке. Когда на руках трое детей и нет никаких постоянных источников дохода, торговля стала единственной возможностью заработать. Не без усилий первый опыт частной предпринимательской деятельности увенчался успехом. Начальный капитал составлял 4 000 сом (KGS), и уже после первого года работы она смогла приумножить свои вложения. После пяти лет торговли на рынке продуктами питания Дамира смогла приобрести павильон и открыть небольшой магазин возле своего дома - и с этого момента торговля в магазинчике стала уже семейным делом. Женился сын, старшая дочка вышла замуж, младшая дочь помогала матери по бизнесу. В 2009 году  Дамира получила свой первый кредит в сумме 100 000 сом в компании «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» и построила магазин на собственном участке. Торговая деятельность стала приносить постоянную прибыль,  росло число клиентов. 
В этот момент в семье случается несчастье – в серьезную автомобильную аварию попал единственный сын и ему потребовалось дорогостоящее лечение. В это же время родилась внучка, что еще увеличило расходы семьи.
Сейчас Дамира планирует получить очередной кредит в сумме 100 000 сомов (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товара в магазине и покупку нового холодильника в магазин. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" (MFC “Bai Tushum and Partners” CJSC) предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Damira was born in the village of Chaldovar (Panfilov Region, Kyrgyzstan), where she still lives now. She is 58 years old. She was the third child in a large low-income family. From an early age she had to help her mother with household duties, which is why she  completed only seven grades of primary school. At 22, she got married. Before long she had a son and later on two daughters. At that time, Damira’s husband started raising sheep, but this work was not particularly profitable. However, steady income was necessary to support the growing family. And this is how, lacking formal education and practical knowledge, Damira decided to go into retail.

Like many in a similar situation, Damira started by selling at the local market. With three children to feed and without a reliable source of income, working as a vendor was the only opportunity to have earnings. After much effort, her first year of entrepreneurship turned out to be successful.
