The starting capital amounted to 4,000 KGS, and already after the first year of work Damira was able to increase her investment. After selling food items at a market for five years, Damira was able to buy a pavilion and open a small grocery store near her home. From then on, retail became a family business. Her son got married, her older daughter too, while the younger daughter started helping with the business. In 2009 Damira obtained her first loan for 100,000 KGS from “Bai Tushum and Partners” and built a store  on her own land plot.  Her retail work started to bring in a steady income; the number of customers kept increasing. 

Then the family had to face an emergency: Damira’s only son was seriously injured in an automobile accident and  required expensive medical care. Around that time, her granddaughter was born, which necessitated further expenses.

At present Damira plans to receive her next loan for 100,000 KGS in order to expand her selection of goods and   buy a new refrigerator for her store.

The MFC “Bai Tushum and Partners,” CJSC offers loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable populations. The MFC “Bai Tushum and Partners,” CJSC is a leading microfinance organizations in Kyrgyzstan. “Bai Tushum and Partners” is a reliable financial partner that contributes to the economic development of Kyrgystan through providing affordable microfinance services in rural and urban areas and thus  promoting the creation of work places and serving the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of goods

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 44 years old and married with three school-age children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines, planting and selling rice. His wife is a housekeeper and his one and only partner in growing their rice farming business.

Nestor is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy rice seeds to grow. He will also buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for plant care, in order to have a better yield. He wants to maintain his business because this is the only source of income that allows him to sustain the needs of his family and the necessities of his children in school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som is 31 years old, living in Siem Reap Province. She is a hard working woman. Since 2009, she runs her business at home by selling groceries. She could earn one dollar per day as her net profit. On the part of her husband is a friendly and experienced craftsman so that he could earn 3.5 dollar per day. Because of his business running smoothly, Mrs.Som and her husband would like to borrow some fund from Kiva loan in order to buy some equipment to make chairs and tables. By expanding business he will get more profit daily so he is able to support his family to live in a very good situation. Apart from that, he has a lovely child and he wanted his child to enter the school. Moreover, he hopes that his child will be able to have a good education and have a good job.

loans.use: to buy some equipment to make chairs and tables.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis manages his rice field business. He is married, and he is 41 years of age and blessed with three school-age children. His wife is housekeeper and the one who assists him in managing their farm. Francis dreams of a better future for his family. He is preparing for his children's education and ensuring they can finish their studies. 

He is asking for a loan of P20,000 to maintain his farming business. He will buy fertilizers and hybrid seeds for farming. He will also use the loan to pay for the labor cost in planting. Francis is looking forward to the success of his business and gaining higher income to further support his children's education and family needs as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and hybrid seeds for rice farming.

loans.name: Yuth

texts.en: Mrs. Yuth is a middle aged woman living in Siem Reap Province. She has worked as a farmer since 2003 and her husband is working in district hall where he earns an average 0.5 dollar per day for net profit. They both have seven children; one is already married and six of them are still under her dependency. Mrs.Yuth and her husband would like to finance from Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizer for their rice field and to repair their plowing machine. In their future, they wish to expand their plantation field by growing more potatoes and to have a wider house. More importantly, they hope that all of their children will have a good education and have good jobs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to repair the plowing machine.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 33 years old and is single. He has owned a small boutique business selling spare parts for the past two years. His business is well organized and he works daily from 7am until 8pm every day. 

Jean de Dieu has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more spare parts for resale. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future, and he will be able to build a house for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 35 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 9 years old. She takes care of six relatives.  Her business is well organized. She has three years of experience and she owns a secondhand clothing business. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy various secondhand clothing to resell. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business, save for the future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase various secondhand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Wende La Panganaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme Noëlie est la représentante du groupe WENDE LA PANGANAABA. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus a âgé a 09 ans et le moins âgé a 09 mois.2 vont a l’école et elle a 07 personnes en charge. 

Mme vend des pagnes depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont ceux qui fréquentent le marché ou elle vend et ses voisins.

Elle veut s’acheter une douzaine de pagne et quelques tenues pour bébés.

Mme économise pour s’acheter une moto. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de pagnes et scolariser ses enfants pour leur assurer un avenir.
texts.en:
Mme Noëlie is the representative of the WENDE LA PANGANAABA group. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is nine and the youngest nine months. Two of them go to school, and Noëlie is responsible for seven people in all. 

Noëlie has been selling African print cloth for three years. She buys her wares in the Sector 10 market. Her customers are people going to the market or she sells to her neighbors. She wants to buy a dozen lengths of African print cloth and some outfits for babies. 

She is saving to buy a motorbike. Her ambition is to open a African print cloth store and to have her children attend school to assure their bright future.

loans.use: to buy a dozen lengths of African print cloth and some baby outfits.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married, and has two children. 

Alaa has owned a grocery store since 1999, selling soft drinks, juices, sweets, cheese, and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting $3000 to renovate his store, make an indoor ceiling, and purchase a generator. He aims to make more money to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his store, make an indoor ceiling, and purchase a generator.

loans.name: Batool

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 44 years old, divorced, and has two children. 

Batool is a photographer; in 1985 she opened her own studio. She has great expertise in this field, a good reputation, and her studio is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

She is requesting a $3000 loan for renovating and tiling the wall of her studio. She is optimistic about her business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring her positive growth.

loans.use: to renovate and tile the wall of her studio.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 30 years old and is married with three children who are between 6 and 10 years old. She earns a living by selling goods such as lotions, soap, sugar, salt, drinks, cakes and so on. This is her second successful year in business. Her business is well-organized. She operates her business from 8 am until 7 pm every day. She employs one person to help her. 

Epiphanie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more lotions, soap, sugar, salt, drinks, cakes and so on for resale. By adding more goods and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family, pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as soap, cooking oil, sugar, drinks etc. for resale.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en: Philomene is 26 years old, single and runs a well-organized business where she sells household items such as soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, cake, drinks and pens. She is applying for this loan through Kiva to buy more items to sell to her customers, and intends to reinvest the profits in her business so that she can eventually earn enough money to build a house.

loans.use: to buy food and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Madjelia

texts.fr:
Mme Madjelia est mariée et sans enfant. Elle a une personne en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes depuis 02ans. Mme s’approvisionne au grand marché de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont ses amis, les gens du quartier.

Elle veut s’acheter un quart de balle de pagnes.

Mme économise pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin de pagnes et aider son mari dans la gestion de leur famille.
texts.en:
Mme Madjelia is married without children. She is responsible for one other person. 

She has been selling African print cloth for two years. She buys her wares at the big market of Ouagadougou. Her customers are her friends and people from her neighborhood. 

She wants to buy a quarter of a bale of African print cloth. 

She is saving to expand her business. Her ambition is to open a big store selling African print cloth and to help her husband support their family.

loans.use: to buy a quarter of a bale of African print cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, fish and oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 50 bags of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, beans and rice for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase five cartons of whisky for her business.

loans.name: Phoibe

texts.en:
Phoibe is 53 years old and married. She sells fruits and vegetables and her business is well organized. The hours of her business are from 7am to 7pm every day. She has 20 years' experience in this business. 
Phoibe has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale. With her profit, she will reinvest in her business, save for her future and will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en: Dorcus is 31 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single and has three children. All of her children are presently in school. For the past five years, she has been selling Fufu (an African food made from cassava) in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase five bags of Fufu (an African food made from cassava) for her business. She plans to educate her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of Fufu

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Ami est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un gendarme. Elle a 04 enfants. 
Ami travaille comme restauratrice depuis 2002. Elle achète les produits au GRAND MARCHE de LOME. Elle travaille avec 02 personnes 
Ami a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de riz, de mais, 03 bidons d’huile.
texts.en:
Ami is a 42-year-old woman. She is married to a police officer and has four children. She has been working as a restauranteur since 2002. She purchases her goods at the GRAND MARCHE of LOME. She works with two persons. 

Ami has requested a second loan cycle with WAGES in order to buy sacks of rice and corn and 3 containers oil.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 23-year-old single man who works as a driver for a car rental company in order to cover his university and personal expenses. Mohamad is a man with good reputation, recommended to deal with by most of his instructors and bosses. 

Mohamad is a hardworking man. He works hard to finish his education and search for a suitable long-term job that fits his chosen career. 

Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for the first time to pay for his last semester at the university. He will graduate soon and start his official career, the one he's been working hard for the past couple of years to reach. He hopes he can keep his parents proud of him and fulfill his desires.

loans.use: To pay for his university education fees

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de son de riz (un aliment qui sert à nourrir les poules). Elle a 57ans et mariée à un agent à la retraite. Ce quatrième prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des sacs de son de riz à l’intérieur du pays et de revendre à ceux qui élèvent les poules. Elle a démarré en 2008.
texts.en: A seller of rice bran (used to feed chickens). She is 57 years old and married to a retired public servant. This loan is the fourth one she has requested. It will enable her to buy sacks of rice bran from the country's interior and to resell the goods to those who raise hens. She started off in 2008.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice bran

loans.name: Rihannata

texts.fr:
Mme Rihannata est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 35ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 10 personnes a sa charge.

Elle vend du charbon de bois depuis 8ans. Mme s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Ses clients sont ses voisins.

Mme veut s’acheter 20sacs de charbon de bois.

Avec ses économies, elle aide son mari dans les dépenses familiales. Mme ambitionne vendre en gros son charbon et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Rihannata is married and the mother of four children. The eldest is 35 years old, and the youngest is 20. None are attending school. She has ten persons to support. Rihannata has been selling charcoal for eight years. She gets her supplies from surrounding villages. Her customers are her neighbors. 

Rihannata wants to buy 20 sacks of charcoal. With her savings, she helps out her husband to cover family expenses. Her ambition is to sell charcoal in bulk and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel, aged 29, is married to Ekirah and they have two children. He operates an auto shop at Grogan trading area. Samuel has been running this business for six years now.

This is the second loan he is getting from KADET and he intends to use the loan to buy some engines, tires, glue gum and pliers. Besides this business, he also runs a press work business and other motor vehicles.

loans.use: to buy engines, tires, glue, gum, and pliers

loans.name: Abla Céline

texts.fr:
Abla Céline est une femme âgé(e) de 28ans. Elle est mariée å un technicien en informatique. Elle a 01 enfant, 
Abla Céline travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2006. Elle achète les mèches  et pagnes au Grand Marché de Lomé 
Abla Céline a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches et pagnes
texts.en:
Abla Céline is a 28 year old woman.  She is married to a computer technician. She has one child.
Abla Céline has been working as a hair stylist since 2006.  She buys hairpieces and pagnes (colorful cloth used for clothing) at the main market in Lomé.  She has requested her third loan with WAGES in order to buy hairpieces and pagnes. 

Abla Céline est une femme âgé(e) de 28ans. Elle est mariée å un technicien en informatique. Elle a 01 enfant, 
Abla Céline travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2006. Elle achète les mèches  et pagnes au Grand Marché de Lomé 
Abla Céline a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches et pagnes

loans.use: to buy hairpieces and pagnes.

loans.name: Agater

texts.en: Agater is a widow. She has six children, five of whom are in school. She took loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and mangoes and expand her business. She will use the loan to pay for school fees of her children and build a new house and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and mangoes for sale

loans.name: Lizzie

texts.en:
Lizzie is a single lady who is 38 years old and the mother of a 13-year-old child. She sells curio items, cereals and different products to her customers. She has been in this business for a period of two years now.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. With this loan, she plans to buy more curios and cereals. She desires to grow and become a great exporter of curios to other countries.

loans.use: to buy more curio items to sell

loans.name: Kwamé

texts.fr:
Kwamé est un homme âgé de 23 ans. Il est célibataire 
Kwamé travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend à domicile à toutes personnes et achète à BADJA.
 Kwamé a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de mais.
texts.en:
Kwamé is a 23 year old man.  He is single.
Kwamé has been working as a salesman since 2010.  He sells to people from his home and buys his supplies in Badja.
He is requesting his first loan through WAGES in order to buy sacks of corn.


Kwamé est un homme âgé de 23 ans. Il est célibataire 
Kwamé travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend à domicile à toutes personnes et achète à BADJA.
 Kwamé a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de mais.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 31 años es una madre pujante y trabajadora. Tiene un hijo de 5 años, esta casada y vive con su hijo y su esposo en una casa propia. El trabajo de Diana empieza por la mañana cuando tiene preparar a su hijo para mandarlo al jardín, luego visita a sus amigos, colegas y familiares ofreciendo los calzados que le envían de la ciudad de Lima para su venta.  Ella tiene que trabajar sola en la venta de zapatos pues su esposo maneja una mototaxi que compraron con el anterior préstamo realizado con la institución.Diana es feliz con su trabajo porque junto a su esposo hacen un mejor ingreso económico. Ella también es profesora en una institución educativa, pero su sueldo de docente muchas veces no es suficiente para solventar sus gastos. En el futuro el plan de Diana es comprar una mototaxi más para poder tener un ingreso más.Este es el tercer préstamo de Diana y espera poder seguir trabajando con la institución y con su grupo de socias ya que son muy unidas y sobre todo responsables.Con el préstamo solicitado espera poder dar una inicial para una mototaxi que tiene en mente poder comprar.
texts.en:
Diana, 31, is a vigorous, hard working mother.  She has a 5-year-old son, is married and lives with her son and husband in her own house.  Diana’s work starts in the morning when she gets her son ready for Kindergarten.  Then, she visits her friends, colleagues and family members to offer shoes that are shipped to her from Lima to sell.  She has to work selling shoes by herself because her husband drives a mototaxi that they purchased with the previous loan they got from the institution.  

Diana is happy with her work because together with her husband she’s producing better income.  She also works as a Teacher at a school but her teacher’s salary often is insufficient to cover her expenses.  Diana’s future plan is to buy another mototaxi to have an additional source of income.

This is Diana’s third loan and she expects to continue to work with the institution and with her group of members who are very unified and, above all, responsible.  She will use the requested loan to make the down payment on a mototaxi she’s thinking about buying.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Kalbubu's Group

texts.en:
Kalbubu is the treasurer of this group. She is 58 and married to a teacher. Together with her husband, she has raised five sons and two daughters. The youngest son studies at the university and all the other children are married and live separately with their families. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, Kalbubu started to provide sewing services. She sews Kyrgyz national felt products. In this way, she adds an additional 5,000 soms to family budget. This profit helps her to meet their daily needs. Kalbubu applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase more wool, fabrics and materials. In the future, with the profits gained from this business, she wants to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more wool, fabrics and materials

loans.name: Akovi

texts.fr:
Akovi est un homme âgé de 37 ans. Il est marié à une couturière. Il a 01 enfant 
Akovi travaille comme frigoriste depuis 2000. Il sert ses  clients à BE KPOTA. Il achète les produits à LOME. Il travaille avec 01 employé. 
Akovi a requis son quatrième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des compresseurs.
texts.en:
Akovi, 37, is married to a seamstress and has one child. 
 
Akovi has been working in refrigerator repair since 2000. He serves his clients at BE KPOTA. He buys his products in LOME. He works with one employee.
 
Akovi has requested fourth loan through WAGES in order to buy compressors.

loans.use: to buy compressors.

loans.name: Khyod

texts.fr:
Homme de 37ans, célibataire et père de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie de 7ans à 15ans, ayant quittée sa scolarité il se lance dans la vente des vivre frais en 2006. Son revenu journalier est de 25000 à 100000 frs par jour. 

Avec ce  prêt il  aimera agrandir son activité en achetant des vivres frais tels que des cartons de cuisse de poulet, des poissons de mer, des cartons de viande, des cartons de triple.

Sa stratégie est de faire des promotions de ses produits, avoir des prix abordable, avoir des meilleurs produits dans sa boucherie. 

Son ambition est d'aller acheter les produits à l'étranger et être grossiste des produits vivre frais car il pense beaucoup améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Son entourage est content de lui car il se débrouille bien.
texts.en:
This man is 37 years old, single, and a father of two children aged 7 and 15. After leaving school, he started selling fresh foods in 2006. His daily income varies between 25,000 and 100,000 XOF.

With this loan, he would like to grow his business by buying fresh products such as boxes of chicken thighs, saltwater fish, meat and tripe.

His strategy is to promote his products, to have reasonable prices, and to have better products in his butcher shop.

His ambition is to go purchase products abroad and to become a wholesaler of fresh products, because he thinks a lot about improving his family's living conditions. His friends and family are happy with him because he is doing well.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken thighs and saltwater fish.

loans.name: Juana Patricia

texts.es: Juana, de 33 años es conviviente y madre de dos hijos de 15 y 07 años con quienes vive en casa de los padres de su pareja.Juana tiene como trabajo la venta de abarrotes y otros productos de primera necesidad el cual  realiza en casa de sus suegros. Se despierta temprano al mercado a realizar la compra de los productos de diario como pollo; verduras y algunos tubérculos; cuando vuelve saca los productos a la vereda de la casa y empieza con la venta. Tiene 5 años en esta actividad que realiza sola.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede utilizar su tiempo para hacer otras actividades, además cuando tiene un tiempo libre se va al mercado a vender algunos productos, sobre todo sabanas y cochas. Sin embargo lo único que no  le gusta de su trabajo es tener que mover todos los días sus productos ya que su venta es en la casa de sus suegros y tiene que colocarlos en el espacio que sus suegros le dieron.Este es el décimo préstamo entre Juana Patricia y la institución MFP, le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque hasta ahora no tiene inconvenientes y espera poder seguir así.Con el préstamo solicitado de 2500 soles ella comprará productos y abarrotes para su tienda.
texts.en:
Juana, 33, has a spouse and is the mother of two children who are 15 and 7 years old.  They all live in her spouse’s parents’ house.  

Juana works selling groceries and other basic need items at her in-laws’ house.  She wakes up early and goes to the market to make her daily purchase of such items like chicken, vegetables, a few tubers.  When she returns home, she displays her products on the path alongside the house and starts her sales.  

She’s been in this line of work for five years and she does it alone.  What she enjoys about her work is being able to use her time to do other things.  When she has free time she goes to the market to sell other products, especially sheets and bedspreads.  However, the only thing she doesn’t like about her work is having to move her products daily because the sales take place at the house of her in-laws and she has to place them in the space her in-laws gave her.

This is Juana Patricia’s 10th loan with MFP.  She enjoys working with her group because, to date, she’s had no inconveniences and she hopes to continue that way.  She will use the requested 2500 soles to buy products and groceries for her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 46-year-old single man who has been selling coffee since 2010. He is a hard worker who tries his best to struggle for his living. Hussein is a well-known man, with good client service and he serves quality coffee. Hussein has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two consecutive cycles. His previous loan was used to improve his business and it had a positive effect on his social and financial situations. This time he's requesting the loan to buy a new espresso machine, in addition to increasing his tobacco capital. Hussein is working hard to expand his business, through increasing his machines and capital, and hopes to expand his place to a wide coffee shop, that attracts different populations.

loans.use: To buy a new espresso machine

loans.name: Charles Louanga

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 46 ans, marie et père d’un enfant de 8 ans.
Ne pouvant poursuivre ses études supérieures par manque d’appui financier, il se lance en 1987  dans la vente des produits alimentaires et  du bois de chauffe.

Au regard de la forte demande dans son quartier, le prêt permettre de renforcer le stock des produits comme, 200 paquets de bois de chauffe, cartons de lait cowbell,  carton de tomate, savons de lessive et détergents.
Sa stratégie est de beaucoup épargner, et vendre des produits de bonne qualité pour satisfaire sa clientèle.
Ayant déjà une grande expérience, pour le futur il pense ouvrir une grande boutique. Et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
This customer is 46 years old, married and father of one 8-year-old child. Unable to proceed with his college studies for lack of financial support, he got his start selling groceries and firewood in 1987.

Given the high demand in his district, the loan will allow him to build up his stock of products such as 200 bundles of firewood, Cowbell milk cartons, tomatoes, laundry soap and detergents.

His strategy is to save a lot and to sell quality products to satisfy his customers. As he already has a lot of experience, he is considering opening a large shop in the future and wants to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy 200 bundles of firewood, Cowbell milk cartons, detergents and tomatoes.

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr:
Karim est un homme âgé de 45ans. Il est marié å une couturière. Il a 02 enfants.  
Karim travaille comme vendeur de CD, Télévision, DVD depuis 2005. Il  vend à ses clients dans le quartier de BE. Il achète les produits au Grand marché de Lomé. Il travaille avec 01  employé. 
Karim a requis son cinquième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter 06 télévisions, des DVD, des CD.
texts.en:
Karim is a 45-year old man. He is married to a seamstress. He has two children. Since 2005. Karim works as a vendor of TV sets, CDs,   and DVDs. He sells in the Be neighborhood. He stocks up at the Big market of Lomé. He also employs one person to work with him.

Karim has requested his fifth-cycle loan from WAGES in order to purchase six TV sets, and some DVDs and CDs.

loans.use: To buy CDs, DVDs and TV sets

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 34 years old, married and the father of two small children. For the last 14 years, he has earned a living by selling books and stationary in a store his father opened many years ago and worked very hard to improve. Today, the business is Hussein's major source of income and one reason why he is a loyal Al Majmoua borrower. He has taken out and repaid 10 previous loans, and has a reputation as a responsible and hard-working businessman. He is committed to provide his children with a good life and a top-notch education, and is applying for a new loan to make sure his store has the books and stationary required by most schools in his area. Hussein hopes to expand his business in the future by opening a second location.

loans.use: to buy school books and stationary for the upcoming 2011-2012 school year.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.pt:
Natural do distrito de Milange provincia de Tete, pai de  dois filhos com idades compreendidas entre 2 a 4 anos de idade, residente na zona turistica da Ponta de Ouro no distrito de Matutuine. 
Trabalha numa instancia turistica e recebe cerca de 3.500,00mt que aplica no sustento da sua familia e poupa um pouco no banco comercial(BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adsema apartir de conversas com seus colegas de servço e vizinhos, e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos. O seu primeiro emprestimo foi no valor de 5.000,00Mts para compra de produtos para venda, no segundo emprestimo foi para compra de cimento para fazer blocos.
 No presente emprestimo de 14.000,00Mts pretende comprar material de construcao a9 cimento,pedre e outros ) para dar inicio a construcao de uma casa de material convencional.
 Tenciona ver sua casa concluida e para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Born in the district of Milange in the Tete province, Alexandre is the father of two children between the ages of 2 and 4 and he lives in the tourist region of Ponta de Ouro in the district of Matutuine.
He works in a tourist resort and earns around 3,500 meticals (MZN) which he uses to support his family and to save some money in the bank (BCI).
He heard about Hluvuku-Adsema through conversations with his colleagues at work and with neighbours. He decided to get closer in order to request clarification on the process for becoming a Hluvuku client and to benefit from financing to carry out his projects. His first loan was for the value of 5,000 MZN to buy products to sell on, his second was for the purchase of cement to make cement blocks. 
With the current loan of 14,000 MZN he intends to buy construction materials (cement, stone and others) to start building a house from conventional building materials.
He intends to see his house completed and for this he counts on Hluvuku-Adsema for further financing.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (cement, stone and others)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase construction materials (cement and payment of labour) to finish building her home

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito da Matola provincia de Maputo e  tem como nivel academico  Basico. Divorciada e mae de  uma filha ainda menor de idade, reside na Ponta dou ouro e trabalha numa instancia turistica onde recebe um salario no valor de 4.000,00mt que aplica nas  despesas da casa e poupa um pouco num Banco comercial.
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adsema apartir de conversas com seu ex-marido,  cunhados e colegas de trabalho, e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
Vem a tornar-se cliente da Hluvuku ha mais de 6 meses. O seu primeiro emprestimo foi no valor de 8.000,00Mts para compra de chapas de zinco e pagamento de mao-de-obra.
 Com o  presente emprestimo de 15.000, pretende comprar material de construcao ( cimento, areia e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para construcao da sua casa propria e de materiasl convencional.
Tenciona ver sua casa concluida e sua pequena mercearia feita e para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Cristina was born in the District of Matola in the province of Maputo and she has the basic level of education. Divorced and the mother of a daughter who is still underage, she lives in Ponta de Ouro and works in a tourist resort where she receives a salary of 4,000 meticals (MZN) which she uses on household expenses and to save some money in a commercial bank.
She came to know of Hluvuku-Adsema through conversations with her ex-husband, sisters-in-law and work colleagues. She decided to get closer in order to request clarification on the process for becoming a Hluvuku client and to benefit from financing to carry out her projects.
She became a Hluvuku client over 6 months ago. Her first loan was for the value of 8,000 MZN to purchase sheets of zinc and to pay for labour.
With the current loan of 15,000 MZN she intends to purchase construction materials (cement, sand and payment of workmanship) to build her own house from conventional materials.
She intends to see the build of her house and small grocery store completed and for this she will count on Hluvuku-Adsema for further loans.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (cement, sand and payment of workmanship)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase construction materials (cement, sand and payment of labour)

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Nimia, de 48 años es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y sobre todo muy alegre y soñadora; vive con dos sus dos hijas. Ellas y su conviviente residen en una casa propia en el distrito de Manantay. El trabajo de Nimia es muy duro, ella se tiene que levantar muy temprano en busca de pollos frescos y grandes al mejor precio en el mercado de la Bellavista, el mercado de la ciudad. Por las noches, prepara todo para vender en la vereda de su casa, tiene la ayuda de sus dos hijas y viene trabajando ya dos años en este negocio.
Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que puede trabajar a lado de sus hijas y así enseñarles  desde pequeñas el valor de la responsabilidad sin descuidar los estudios. Nimia siente que su negocio es muy rentable ya que vende un mínimo de cinco pollos al día que le genera una buena ganancia.Ella quisiera poder tener una ramada más grande y poder poner ahí una tienda de venta de pollos grande.Este es el tercer préstamo entre Nimia y la institución MFP esta muy contenta pues considera que en su grupo son responsables y todos se llevan bien.	
Con el préstamo solicitado 1500 soles, ella comprará materiales para armar un local mas grande en su casa, también comprar menajeria para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nimia, 48, is a hardworking, responsible and, above all, very cheerful and a dreamer.  She lives with her two daughters.  She and her spouse live in a house of their own in Manantay District.  Nimia’s work is very hard.  She has to rise very early to seek out fresh, large chickens at the best possible price in the Bellavista Market, the city’s market.  At night, she prepares everything to sell along the path at her house.  Her two daughters help her and she’s been working in this business for two years now.

What she likes about the work is being able to work alongside her daughters and teaching them from a very young age to value responsibility while not neglecting their studies.  Nimia feels that her business is very profitable since she sells a minimum of five chickens daily generating good profits.  She’d like to have a larger space to install a bigger chicken store.  This is Nimia’s third loan from MFP and she is very happy because she considers her group to be very responsible and they all get along well together.  She will use the requested 1500 new sol loan to buy building materials to enlarge the space in her house and will also buy more kitchenware to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to buy kitchenware.

loans.name: Betuel

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, tem 22 anos de idade vive maritalmente, é pai de 2 filhos de 4 e 2 anos não vão a Escola, fez a 7ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições. Vive na casa própria e responsabiliza se pela sua mãe e irmã que vivem com ele.

iniciou sua actividade pesqueira e comercial ha mais de cinco anos. Hoje é proprietário de um barco a remo e um estabelecimento comercial onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade. Vende o pescado na sua zona e tem como rendimento mensal 10.000,00mt que aplica nas despesas domesticas e pouca algum valor num Banco comercial. Tem dois empregados sanzonais que os paga em funcao da producao que consegue.
 
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros Bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atraves de amigos que são nossos clientes. Este é o quarto empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção( blocos, areia, cimento e barrotes) para dar inicio da sua nova obra, os anteriores de (5.000.00,  10.000.00 e 15.000.00 )mt forão para o comércio.Tem como objectivo concluir sua casa porque nos negócios ja se encontra estavel.
texts.en:
Betuel was born in the city of Matola, Province of Maputo in the South of Mozambique; he is 22 years old and lives with his wife. He is the father of 2 children aged 4 and 2 who don’t go to school and he completed 7th grade but circumstances didn’t allow him to continue. He lives in his own house and is responsible for his mother and sister who both live with him.

He started his commercial fishing activity more than five years ago. Today he is the owner of a rowing boat and a commercial establishment where he sells essential products. He sells fish in his area and earns 10,000 meticals (MZN) a month, which he uses for household expenses and saves the rest in a commercial bank. He has two seasonal employees who are paid based on productivity.

He has never had loans from any other banks and he came to know Hluvuku through friends who are our clients. This is his fourth loan, for the amount of 20,000 MZN with which he intends to purchase construction materials (blocks, sand, cement and beams) to start his new building work. His previous loans for 5,000, 10,000 and 15,000 MZN were for his business. He aims to complete his house as his business is already stable.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (blocks, sand, cement and beams)

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 24-year-old married man. He has worked in furniture making since 15 years ago. He was too small when he started working but it's all because he had to help his parents in covering their expenses and struggling for a living.

Mahmoud is a man with a good reputation; he seeks perfection in his work that he started and works hard on improving as much as he can to make sure that this business will provide him with the best living ever for his family members.

That's why Mahmoud requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to buy new and improved machines necessary for developing his business in a short period of time with the best quality of work possible.

This is his first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes it will be a good experience to invest.

loans.use: To buy new and updated machines necessary for his business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is an honest and hardworking 40-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with three children, two of whom are in school. She has been selling fabric for the last year to make a living. Previously, she used to sell cereals. 

She wants in the next five years to have a self-sustaining business that operates on wholesale terms. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric for sale. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for boosting her business financially.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Israel

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 29 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, fez 7ª classe não deu continuidade devido a falta de condições Financeiras. É pai de 2 filhos de 5 e 9 anos, o mais velho é que vai a Escola. Vive na casa própria com sua familia não responsabiliza se por ninguem.

Actualmente trabalha  e reside no Distrito de Namaacha e é funcionario permante ha mais de 2 anos na Empresa Agua da auferindo mensalmente 4.200.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra.  

Nunca  trabalhou com outros Bancos  alêm da Hluvuku, este é seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção nomeadamente( cimento, areia e blocos) para dar continuidade da obra DE CONSTRUCAO DA SUA CASA. Esta disposto a pagar antes do tempo para aceder a outros créditos.
texts.en:
Israel was born in Namaacha District. He is 29 years old and is married. He finished seventh grade but did not continue school because of financial problems. Israel has two children, ages five and nine; the eldest goes to school. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else.

Israel currently lives and works in Namaacha District. He has been a permanent employee at the water company for more than two years, earning 4,200 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and his construction project.

He has never worked with other banks besides Hluvuku. This is his first loan, and he is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy construction materials, namely cement, sand, and blocks, to continue with his housing project. He is willing to pay off the loan ahead of time so he will be able to get other loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, namely cement, sand and blocks.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 44 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é mãe de 6 filhos de 3 aos 27 anos de idade. Três é que vão a Escola, fez a 2ª classe não concluiu devido ao tempo porque seu pai obrigava lhe a passar a maior parte do tempo trabalhando na machamba, vive na casa própria.
Começa a fazer negócio de pequena escala vendendo pasteis nas esquinas da escola, mas com ajuda do seu marido consegue aranjar uma banca no Mercado Central onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade tais como( tomate, cebola, cenoura e arroz) tem gastado uma média de 8.000.00mt nas compras e tendo de lucro 3.000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da obra. Vende, tambem, refeições no Mercado( sopa) diariamente  consegue ter 350mt. Conta  tambem com ajuda do seu marido. 
Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume dos seus produtos, o anterior de 5.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt foi usado para o negócio, pagou com muito sucesso, esta cofiante que fara o mesmo neste segundo para aceder a mais empréstimos pois gostaria tanto de ajudar sua filha que se encontra desempregada.
texts.en:
Maria was born in Namaacha District. She is 44 years old, is married and has six children between 3 and 27 years old. Three of the children go to school. Maria finished second grade but did not have time to finish school because her father made her spend most of her time working on their farm. She lives in her own house.

She began a small business selling turnovers at the corners by the school, but with her husband's help she was able to get a stand at the Central Market where she sells basic goods like tomatoes, onions, carrots and rice. She has spent an average of 8,000 meticais on her purchases and has a profit of 3,000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses and construction. Maria also sells meals (soups) daily and earns 350 meticais. She also relies on her husband's help.

This is her third loan with Hluvuku. She is asking for 10,000 meticais to increase her inventory. The earlier loans were for 5,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais and were used for her business. She paid them off successfully and is confident that she will do the same on this loan so she can get more loans, as she would really like to help her daughter, who is currently unemployed.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (rice, onions, sugar and other items).

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a hardworking 39-year-old business lady. She is single and blessed with a school-going child. For the last five years, she has been making a living from her cafeteria. She wants in the next five years to have expanded her business premises and to renovate. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as wheat flour and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as wheat flour and potatoes.

loans.name: Ramos

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 26 anos de idade, é casado não tem filhos, fez a 12ª classe. Vive na casa da mãe e responsabiliza se por ela e pelos seus três irmãos que vivem com ele em sua casa. 

Fez curso de professorado e por ser o mais velho da casa fica na responsabilidade da familia. É Docente e funcionario permanente ha mais de 8 anos com a categoria de Director da Escola auferindo mensalmente 9.060.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa.  Com o emprestimo Pretende antes  concluir a obra de uma casa para sua mãe para posteriormente iniciar a construcao da sua própria casa de materia convencional. Conta com ajuda da sua esposa que tambem é Docente.

Este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( chapas de zinco, cimento e areia) para dar continuidade da obra da sua mãe. O anterior de 10.000.00mt foi para habitação. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para iniciar a sua própria obra.
texts.en:
Ramos was born in Namaacha District. He is 26 years old, is married and has no children. He finished twelfth grade. Ramos lives in his mother's house and supports her and his three siblings, who live with him in the house.

Ramos took the teaching course, and because he is the oldest in the house he is responsible for the family. He is a teacher and has been a permanent employee for more than eight years, working as a school principal and earning 9,060 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses. With the loan Ramos intends to first finish a house for his mother and then begin construction of his own house with conventional materials. He relies on the help of his wife, who is also a teacher.

This loan of 20,000 meticais is his second Hluvuku loan. He intends to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, cement and sand) to continue work on his mother's house. The earlier loan was for 10,000 meticais and was for housing. Ramos is confident that he will pay off this loan ahead of time and ask for another so he can begin his own house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, cement and sand).

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a hardworking and ambitious businessman. He is married and blessed with four children who are school-going. For the last 11 years, he has been offering laundry services to make his living and he supplements this with the income he earns from farming. Previously, he used to work as a carpenter. He wants in the next five years to have opened up other branches so that he is able to realize his dream of owning a dry cleaning company. He is requesting a loan of a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dry cleaning machine. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for inculcating in him the saving culture.

loans.use: to buy a dry cleaning machine

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis, 25, is a hardworking and honest businessman. He is married and blessed with a one-year-old child. For the last two years, he has been meeting the needs of his family by selling fish. He wants in the next five years to have penetrated larger markets so that he is able to realize his dream of becoming a landlord in as short a time as possible. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more fish. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for empowering him economically.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is a focused and hardworking 67-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with grown-up children. For the last 30 years, he has been carrying out farming, especially tree seedlings. He also makes extra coins by making traditional stools to meet the needs of his family more comfortably. He wants in the next five years to have prospered and to be the supplier of seedlings to various institutions. He is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow. He bought two dairy cows with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 33 years old. She is married and blessed with three children who are 10, 6, and 3 years old. The children go to school. For the last four years, she has been operating a retail shop to provide for her family. She wants in the next five years to have expanded her business into wholesale.  She is requesting 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy soap, sweets and biscuits. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making finances available to her.

loans.use: To buy soap, sweets and biscuits

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick, 41, is a focused, committed and business-oriented businessman. He is married and blessed with five children who are going to school. For the last 12 years, he has been offering veterinary services to make a living, which he supplements with the earnings he gets from dairy farming. He wants in the next five years to be selling dairy products on a large scale and his dream is to own his own milk processing plant. He is requesting a loan of 45,000 Kenya shillings to buy a computer and a printer so that he can start a bureau. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya since he is now able to manage his business wisely and effectively.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a printer

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann was born in 1980 and she is an ambitious business lady. She is married and blessed with a two-year-old child. Since the year 2005, she has been selling African Design fabric to make a living. She wants in the next five years to have moved into her own shop and her dream is to penetrate the outside market through exports. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy African design fabric. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now a good saver.

loans.use: To buy African Design fabric

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter, 26, is a hardworking and honest businessman. He is married and blessed with two children who go to school. For the last year, he has been operating a cafeteria to make a living. Previously, he was employed. His dream and aspiration is to be an owner of a restaurant. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy two tanks of water, two tables and two cooking pots. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has learned the art of saving.

loans.use: To buy two tanks of water, two tables and two cooking pots

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 31, is a single, patient, hardworking, and focused business lady. For the last four years, she has been operating an M-pesa service (mobile phone money transfer business) to make a living. She wants in the next five years to have opened up other outlets in other places in the country. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop dealing with mobile phones. She is requesting 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy phone accessories and float money. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has now become financially literate.

loans.use: To buy phone accesories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric for sewing and a bale of second hand clothes

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline, 26, is a hardworking and industrious business lady. She is married and blessed with two children who are going to school. For the last year, she has been providing for her family by running a general shop. She wants in the next five years to be an owner of a wholesale shop. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cereals and a refrigerator. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching her business management skills.

loans.use: To buy cereals and a refridgerator

loans.name: Transito

texts.es:
Transito tiene 36 años de edad, es casada vive con su esposo e hijos de 16, 12, 10 y 2 años, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

Transito se dedica al comercio de legumbres, agricultura, crianza de animales, el esposo se dedica a la albañilería, tiene un medio solar, casa propia, siembra maíz, trigo, habas, papas, además tiene una vaca y un cerdo. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.
 
Solicita el crédito para, compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos e incrementar su negocio. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos el incremento y caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los bruscos cambios climáticos por los que estamos atravesando. Su sueño es ampliar su producción  y sacar a sus hijos adelante. 

Le gusta las fiestas, realizar actividades domésticas, pasear.
texts.en:
Transito is 36 years old, married, and she lives with her husband and her children, aged 16, 12, 10 and 2. They live in the canton of Guaranda in the Bolivar province.

The communal bank "Alli Kausay" is located in the community of Tolapungo, in the sector of Veintimilla. It belongs to the canton of Guaranda. The members of this group are dedicated to agriculture, raising livestock, and selling cattle, vegetables and other products.

Transito sells vegetables and she is an agriculturist as well as a livestock farmer. Her husband is a construction worker. They have a greenhouse, a house of their own, and they plant corn, wheat, fava beans, potatoes and they also have a cow and a pig. She busy and sells her products in the wholesalers market in Guaranda.

She requests a loan to purchase fertilizers and products for the cultivation to increase her business. The loan will help her to meet her financial needs and to improve her agricultural activities. She is faced with the variable prices of products that she sells, as well as the sudden changes in climate that we are experiencing. Her dream is to increase her production and to provide for her children.

She enjoys parties, house work, and traveling.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and products to improve her agricultural business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cement, window frames and stone

loans.name: Yesenia Maria

texts.es:
Yesenia María tiene 29 años de edad, es casada vive con su esposo e hijos de 11, 10 años y 4 meses, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

Yesenia se dedica al comercio de legumbres, agricultura, crianza de animales, el esposo se dedica a la construcción, tiene una cuadra de terreno, siembra maíz, trigo, habas, papas, además tiene dos vacas lecheras. Compra sus productos en Ambato y vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.
 
Solicita el crédito para, la compras de abonos, semillas comida para los animales y para pagar el transporte. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la presencia de plagas en sus cultivos y falta de dinero. Su sueño es adquirir un vehículo para abaratar costos del producto que siembra.

Le gusta visitar a sus familiares, además las fiestas tradicionales de su comunidad compartir con los amigos.
texts.en:
Yesenia María, 29, is married and lives with her husband and children, who are 11, 10 and 4 years old, in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.

The members of the Calli Kausay communal bank are located in the community of Tolapungo, Veintimilla Sector, belonging to Guaranda Canton.  They are in farming, livestock raising, livestock sales, vegetable sales and others.

Yesenia sells vegetables, farms, and raises livestock.  Her husband works in construction.  She has a cuadra (unit of land measurement) of farmland where she grows corn, wheat, Lima beans and potatoes. She also has two dairy cows.  She buys her products in Ambato and her sales take place in the Guaranda wholesale market.

She is asking for the loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds, feed for her animals, and for transportation costs.  The loan will help her meet her economic needs and improve her farming activities.  She faces challenges like crop pests.  Her dream is to acquire a vehicle to lessen costs of production.

She enjoys visiting her relatives and the community’s traditional festivals.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, feed for her animals, and for transportation costs

loans.name: Mariana

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Bela-Vista, é solteira, de 28 anos de idade, reside em Bela-Vista, tem nível Básico, tem um filho, de 8 anos e Frequenta a 3ª.classe, tem a sua mãe à sua responsabilidade.

É docente há dois anos, trabalha na EPC - Bela-Vista, tem um salário de  4.200.00mt, com o salário compra alimentos para a família, paga outras despesas e não faz poupança.

Nunca teve créditos com outros bancos, conhece a Hluvuku desde a sua criação, o primeiro empréstimo foi de 3.000.00mt para a reparação da geleira, o segundo de 6.000.00mt para a compra de cimento e areia, o actual é de 20.000.00mt destinado a compra de material de construção (blocos, pedra e cimento).

Sonha e concluir a construção da casa da mãe e mobilá-la, e conta com o apoio da Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Mariana was born in Bela-Vista, is single, 28 years old, lives in Bela-Vista and has a basic level of education. She has an 8 year old son who’s in 3rd grade and she also supports her mother.

She has been a teacher for 2 years and works in EPC – Bela-Vista, earning 4,200 meticals (MZN). With her salary she buys food for her family, pays for other expenses and does not save money.

She has never had loans with other banks and has known Hluvuku since its inception. Her first loan was for 3,000 MZN to fix her refrigerator, the second was for 6,000 MZN to purchase cement and sand and the current loan is for 20,000 MZN, destined for the purchase of construction materials (blocks, stone and cement).

She dreams of completing the build of her mother’s house and of furnishing it. She counts on Hluvuku’s support.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (blocks, stone and cement)

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a hardworking 22-year-old business lady. She is married. Since 2010, she has been selling cereals to make ends meet. She wants in the next five years to have expanded her business and her dream is to increase her stock portfolio. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy a stock of cereals. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making finances easily accessible to her.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a hardworking 30-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with one child who attends school. For the last six years, she has been selling handbags to provide for her family. She wants in the next five years to have opened up another shop. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy handbags. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making finances available to her.

loans.use: To buy handbags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair braids, chemicals and shampoos.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
María Rosario tiene 53 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su madre e hijos de 14 y 1 año, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

María se dedica al comercio de ganado, agricultura, tiene 2 cuadras de terreno, siembra maíz, trigo, habas, papas, además tiene dos vacas. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de Guanujo.
 
Solicita el crédito para comprar comida para los animales como balanceados de engorde, ademas abonos para los cultivos. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar su calidad de vida. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída del precio de los animales. Su sueño es trabajar con capital propio.

Le gusta dedicarse a labores del hogar.
texts.en:
María Rosario, 53, is single living with her mother and her children who are 14 and 1 year old in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.

The members of the “Alli Kausay” communal bank are located in the community of Tolapungo, Veintimilla Sector, belonging to Guaranda Canton.  The members are in farming, livestock raising, livestock sales, vegetable sales, and others.

María is a livestock merchant and farmer.  She has two cuadras (unit of land measurement) of land where she grows corn, wheat, Lima beans and potatoes.  She also owns two cows.  Her purchases and sales take place at the Guanujo market.

She is asking for the loan to purchase feed for her animals to fatten them, as well as fertilizer for her fields.  The loan will help her meet her economic needs and improve her quality of life.  She faces challenges like the drop in price of animals.  Her dream is to work with her own capital.  She enjoys doing household chores.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her animals to fatten them, and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijos de 16 y 1 año, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

María se dedica al comercio de ganado, agricultura, crianza de animales, su esposo de dedica a la construcción. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.

Le gusta dedicarse a labores del hogar y pasar mas tiempo con la familia.
texts.en:
María Teresa, 45, is married.  She lives with her husband and children who are 16 and 1 year old in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.

The members of the Calli Kausay communal bank are located in the community of Tolapungo, Veintimilla Sector, belonging to Guaranda Canton.  They are in farming, livestock raising, livestock sales, vegetable sales, and others.

María is a livestock merchant, farmer, raises animals.  Her husband works in construction.  He purchases and sales take place in the Guaranda wholesale market.

She is asking for the loan to purchase heads of cattle, feed, and seeds for her fields.  The loan will help her meet her economic needs and improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to buy a piece of land.  She enjoys going household chores.

loans.use: to purchase heads of cattle, feed, and seeds for her fields

loans.name: Mirian Yolanda

texts.es:
Mirian Yolanda tiene 25 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijo de 1 año, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

Mirian se dedica al comercio de legumbres, agricultura, crianza de animales, su esposo de dedica a la construcción. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.
 
Solicita el crédito para pagar el transporte de legumbres, semillas para los cultivos y alimentacion para los animales de crianza . El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar su calidad de vida. Enfrenta desafíos como la inestabilidad del precio de los animales. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno y construirse una casa en el centro de la ciudad.

Le gusta dedicarse a labores del hogar, y de vez en cuando visitar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mirian Yolanda, 25, is married and lives with her husband and one-year-old son in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.

The members of the Alli Kausay communal bank are located in the community of Tolapungo, Veintimilla Sector, belonging to Guaranda Canton.  They are farmers, raise livestock, sell livestock, sell vegetables and others.

Mirian sells vegetables, farms, and raises animals.  Her husband works in construction.  Her purchases and her sales take place in the Guaranda wholesale market.

She is asking for the loan to pay for the transport of her vegetables, seeds for her fields, and feed for her livestock.  The loan will help her meet her economic needs and improve her quality of life.  She faces challenges like animal price instability.  Her dream is to buy a piece of property and build a house in the center of town.  She enjoys doing household chores and once in a while visiting her family.

loans.use: to pay for the transport of her vegetables, seeds for her fields, and feed for her livestock

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a hardworking businessman.  He owns a school where he employs six people. He has been operating the business for three years.  He gained experience for running the business because he was previously employed as a teacher. Through Faulu Kenya, he was able to open the business.  He also earns extra income from his video shop and motorbike transport business. Joshua hopes to expand his business in the future.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to add classrooms and buy desks and chairs.

loans.use: To add classrooms and buy desks and chairs.

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.es:
María Delia tiene 23 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijo de 2 años, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

María se dedica al comercio de legumbres, agricultura, crianza de animales, siembra de maíz, trigo, fréjol, cebada, su esposo de dedica a la construcción. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.
 
Solicita el crédito para, incrementar su negocio y mejoramiento de sus actividades agrícolas. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar su calidad de vida. Enfrenta desafíos como la inestabilidad del precio de los animales. Su sueño es incrementar su negocio y trabajar con capital propio.

Le gusta dedicarse a labores del hogar.
texts.en:
María Delia, 23 years old, is married and lives with her husband and 2 year old son in Guaranda Canton in Bolivar Province.

The members of the Alli Kausay Communal Bank, located in the Tolapungo community, in the Veintimilla sector of Guaranda Canton, do agricultural work, raising animals, vegetables and other crops, or work in the cattle business.

María works in the agricultural and vegetable trade, raising animals and planting corn, wheat, beans, and barley. She buys and sells her products in the largest market in Guaranda. Her husband works in construction. 
 
She requests the loan in order to increase her business and improve her agricultural activities. The loan will allow her to meet her economic needs and improve her quality of life. She faces challenges like fluctuating animal prices. Her dream is to increase her business and work with her own capital. 

She enjoys doing the housekeeping.

loans.use: to increase her business and improve her agricultural activities.

loans.name: Benkola 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKOLA 1 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, KADIATOU, la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des débout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkola 1 Group are married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have three children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Kadiatou, the first woman standing at the right-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.25 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 25,000 CFA francs by the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a 31-year-old single mother of one. She operates a boutique to earn a living for her family. Being a single mother of one, she works hard in her business to provide for her child.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access business loans, which she has used to boost her business. Linet hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She needs 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric, shoes and shirts.

loans.use: To buy fabric, shoes and shirts

loans.name: Veronica Ines

texts.es:
Verónica Inés tiene 22 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijo de 4 años, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

Verónica se dedica al comercio de legumbres, su esposo de dedica a la construcción. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.
 
Solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio de legunbres y pagas un transporte para el traslado de las legumbres para llevar al mercado a vender. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su sueño es adquirir una casa propia en el sector donde vive. 

Le gusta dedicarse a labores del hogar.
texts.en:
Verónica Inés is 22 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and her four year old son in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar provence.

The members of the Alli Kausay Communal Bank can be found in the Tolapungo community, Veintimilla sector, Guaranda canton.  The members of this communal bank devote themselves to farming, raising ainimals, selling vegetables, and other business activities.

Verónica sells vegetables, and her husband works in construction. She buys and sells her products at the Guaranda wholesale market.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her vegetable business and pay for the transportation of the vegetables to take them to the market to sell.  The loan will be a help to supplement her financial necessities and to improve her quality of life.

Her dream is to get her own house in the sector where she lives.

She likes doing housework.

loans.use: to pay for the transport of her vegetables to market

loans.name: Benkola 2 Group

Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, AWA la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5  hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000F CFA environs par campagne.

Awa, sitting in the middle of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.5 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 40,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 25 years old and married with two children who are in school.  To earn a living, he sells household goods such as utensils, buckets, tablecloths and basins. He has been in the business for six years and has one employee. Joseph testifies that he has managed to buy a pick-up and meet his family’s needs through Faulu Kenya. He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy utensils and tablecloths.

loans.use: To buy utensils and tablecloths

Le gusta tejer y hacer deporte.

María sells vegetables. She buys and sells her products at the Guaranda wholesale market.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables to sell at the market in Guaranda.  The loan will be a help to supplement her financial necessities and to improve her quality of life.

Her dream is to get her own house in the sector where she lives.

She likes knitting and playing sports.

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

María se dedica al comercio de legumbres, Compra sus productos y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.
 
Solicita el crédito para, incrementar su negocio y mejoramiento de sus actividades agrícolas. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su sueño es adquirir un terreno. 

Le gusta escuchar música y ver televisión.
texts.en:
María Gloria is 25 years old, single, and lives with her mother in the canton of Guaranda, in the Bolívar Province.

The members of V.R.C ALLI KAUSAY are located in the Tolapungo community, in the sector Veintimilla, which is part of Guaranda.  The members of this group work in agriculture, raising animals, the cattle industry, the produce industry and others.

María works in the vegetable business.  She buys her produce and resells it at the wholesale market in Guaranda.
 
She requests this loan to increase her business and improve her agricultural activities.  The loan will enable her to supply her financial needs and improve her quality of life. Her dream is to purchase land.

She enjoys listening to music and watching television.

loans.use: to increase her business and improve her agricultural activities

loans.name: Benkola 4 Group

texts.fr:
BENKOLA 4 est constitué de dix membres qui sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MAÏMOUNA, au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70 000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
