The ten members of Benkola 4 Group are married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have three children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Maïmouna, sitting in the middle of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.5 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of around 70,000 CFA francs by the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Benkola 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKOLA 5 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MINATA, au milieu dans le rang des débout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de main d’œuvre pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkola 5 Group are married women who, on average, are 36 years old and have three children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Minata, standing in the middle of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for labor to cultivate around 0.25 hectares of farmland to grow groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 20,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Benkola 6 Group

texts.fr:
BENKOLA 6 est constitué de 10 femmes mariées  qui  ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, KANIMAN,   la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare  de riz.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkola 6 Group are married women who, on average, are 38 years old and have three children. They live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Kaniman, the second woman sitting at the left-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for labor to cultivate around 0.25 hectares of farmland to grow rice. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 25,000 CFA francs by the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Benkola 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe BENKOLA 7 sont des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, NIEBA, la  deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group called BENKOLA 7 are married and have an average age of 34 and on average two children. They live in polygamous families in  Baou, one of the villages of the rural township of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their farming businesses at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are, among others, rice and peanuts. This is their first collaboration with the institution. 

With her share of the loan, Nieba, the second person from the left in the row of seated women, is intending to buy farm inputs and small tools and pay plowing costs to plant about 0.25 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

Their produce is sold at the markets of  Baou, Koula, Banco, and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. They expect to make an average profit of around 20,000 F CFA per growing season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and small tools.

loans.name: Benkola 8 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes qui constituent le groupe BENKOLA 8 sont toutes mariées dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali, avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MAGNINENI, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de main d’œuvre pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  25 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkola 8 group are all married women living in polygamous families in Baou, a village in the rural community of Banco, Dioila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They average 35 years of age and have at least two children each.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with the goal of better  managing their activities during the winter season. They cultivate rice and peanuts [ground nuts], among other cultures. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this loan, Magnieni, the second from the left to the right standing in the photo, plans to purchase agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers or insecticides] and small tools and   pay cost of manual labor to work a field of rice and peanuts in the 0.5 ha [about 1.25 acres]. After harvesting, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Gouboougou, to a customer base composed of both men and women. The group members plan to earn an average income of 25,000 West African franks  each per agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, weeding and small tools

loans.name: Kankoe Georges

texts.fr:
Georges est un homme de 36 ans. Il est marié à une commerçante. Georges est père d’un enfant.
Georges travaille comme couturier depuis 2003.Il achète des tissus et des pagnes  sur les marchés appropriés à Lomé pour la confection des habits prêt à porter. Son atelier se situe à Afanoukopé  la rue en face de la station ; il se fait aider par un employé.
Georges a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter  des tissus et des pagnes pour la confection des habits.
texts.en:
Georges is 36 and married to a small-scale retailer. He is the father of one child. He has been working as a tailor since 2003. He buys textiles and lengths of African print cloth at the markets in  Lomé to use to make ready-to-wear clothing. His workshop is located in Afanoukopé, the street opposite the station. He has one employee to help him. 

He has requested his first-ever loan from WAGES in order to buy textiles and African print cloth to make into clothing.

loans.use: to buy textiles and lengths of African print cloth.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi est un jeune homme de 32 ans. Il est célibataire et sans enfant.
Kossi travaille comme photographe  et comme revendeur depuis 2007.Il revend des cd et des batteries dans sa boutique nommée « About » à Baguida face à la station d’Afanoukopé.Elle achète les batteries et les cd à Lomé. Il travaille avec un employé.
Kossi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afind’acheter des cartons de cd et des batteries.
texts.en:
Kossi is a young man of 32 who is single and has no children. He has been working as a photographer and small-scale retailer since 2007. He sells CDs and batteries in his little shop called « About » in Baguida opposite the Afanoukopé station. He buys his batteries and CDs in Lomé. He works with one employee.

Kossi has requested his first loan from WAGES so as to buy cartons of CDs and batteries.

loans.use: to buy CDs and batteries.

loans.name: Benkola  A Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKOLA A sont des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et qui vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MARIAM, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour environs 0,75 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions  de ces femmes du groupe sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000F CFA environs par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe ambitionnent avec la collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso, augmenter leurs capacités financières et renforcer leurs productivités.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group BENKOLA A are married women with an average age of 37 and on average three childre, who mostly live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages of the rural community of Banco, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are rice and peanuts, among others. They are working together with the institution for the first time. 

With this loan, MARIAM, the first person from the left in the row that is seated, intends to buy farm inputs and small tools and pay for plowing and weeding for about 0.75 hectares of peanuts. 

The produce the women from this group grow will be sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and of N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. They expect to make an average profit of 40,000 F CFA more or less, per growing season. 

The women from this group hope to take advantage of their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso to increase their financial capacity and bolster their harvests.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, fertilizer, weeding and small tools.

loans.name: Martha Consuelo

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene 64 años de edad, es profesora jubilada, es casada, tiene un hijo de 24 años de edad el cual está en la universidad, su esposo es mecánico, la Sra. Martha tiene un bazar donde vende (artículos de librería, perfumería, útiles de escritorio, regalos), ya lleva en este negocio más de un año, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería para su bazar y así aumentar sus ventas. Su sueño principal es poder ampliar su negocio y poner un cafetín; ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que así va a poder crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha is 64 years old and a retired school teacher. She is married and has a 24-year-old son who is attending the university. Her husband is a mechanic. Sra. Martha operates a bazaar where she sells school supplies, perfumes, writing utensils, and gifts. She has been in business for more than a year.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for her bazaar so that she can increase her sales. Her main wish is to expand her business so that she can open a cafeteria. She is extremely grateful for the loan that has been provided so that she can grow in her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell in her bazaar.

loans.name: Benkola B Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes qui constituent le groupe BENKOLA B, ont en  moyenne 39 ans, en moyenne 4 enfants et sont toutes mariées dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, le haricot, le sésame et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, SALIMATA SIDI, la première à droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions  des femmes du groupe BENKOLA B seront vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. SALIMATA SIDI compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000FCFA environs  en fin de campagne.
Les femmes du groupe BENKOLA B espèrent qu’avec cette collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso leurs capacités financières vont se renforcer  et la  productivité est garantie.
texts.en:
The 10 women who make up the BENKOLA B group have an average age of 39 and four children on average. They are all married and living in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages of the rural community of Banco,  Dioïla prefecture,  Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali.

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, rice, beans, sesame seeds, and peanuts. They are on their first collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this loan, SALIMATA SIDI, first on the right in the row of seated women, intends to buy farm inputs, various small equipment, and pay for plowing to maintain about 0.75 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

The produce of the BENKOLA B group will be sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, to a clientele composed of men and women. SALIMATA SIDI expects to make an average profit of 60,000 F CFA at the end of the season. 

The women of the BENKOLA B group hope that with this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso their financial capacity will be greater and that productivity is guaranteed.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seed, fertilizer, herbicide and various small tools.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa  est une femme âgée de 66 ans. Elle est veuve et a trois enfants.
Akossiwa travaille  comme  revendeuse de charbons de bois depuis 2006.Elle vend à domicile  dans sa maison sise à Ablogamé.Elle s’approvisionne à Notsé.
Akossiwa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois.
texts.en: Akossiwa is 66 years old. She is widowed and the mother of three children. She has been earning her living since 2006 by selling charcoal. She sells out of her house in Ablogamé. She gets her supplies in Notsé. Akossiwa came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy charcoal.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Benkola C Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKOLA C sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution et MAGNINE ALOU  qui est la deuxième assises à droite avec une écharpe blanche, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz.
Les productions des femmes seront gardées pendant un temps puis seront vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the BENKOLA C group are married women with an average age of 32 and three children on average. They mostly live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages of the rural community of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali.

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, millet, rice, and peanuts. They are on their first collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and MAGNINE ALOU, seated second on the right with a white scarf, intends to use her loan to buy farm inputs and small agricultural equipment and pay for plowing to maintain about 0.5 hectares of rice.

The produce of these women will kept for a time and then sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, to a clientele composed of retailers and consumers. They expect to make an average profit of 25,000 F CFA, more or less, each season.

loans.use: to pay for laborers, farm inputs, and small agricultural equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase snacks, staple foods, cleaning products, bread, canned goods, and soup

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 17,16 y 11 años  de edad, la Sra. Rosa es confeccionista de ropa, parches y venta de ropa que ella misma confecciona, ya lleva en el negocio más de 2 años y decidió este trabajo porque estudio para confección en la universidad la Cantuta. La Sra. Rosa es muy conocida en la ciudad por sus bonitos diseños que ella misma crea. El crédito lo va a invertir en ampliar su negocio y en la compra de tela para sus creaciones textiles. Su sueño principal es poder ampliar su negocio y ser reconocida en todo Nazca y aun día exportar su ropa al extranjero; ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que así va a poder crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is 45 years old and a single mother with three children (ages 17, 16, and 11). She earns her livelihood by making, mending, and selling clothes. Rosa has been in business for more than two years and decided to pursue this line of work because she studied dressmaking at La Cantuta University.

Sra. Rosa is well-known in the city for the beautiful designs that she creates. This loan will be invested in the expansion her business. She plans to buy fabrics used in her creations. Her main wish is to expand her business so that she becomes known throughout all of Nazca. Someday she would like to export her clothing abroad. Rosa is extremely grateful for the loan that has been provided because it will allow her to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Benkola  D Group

texts.fr:
BENKOLA D est un regroupement de dix membres qui sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, le niébé, le pois de terre et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, FANTA qui est la première assise à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions, après un certains temps de garde, sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
BENKOLA D is a group of ten members who are married women with an average age of 34 and on average three children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages of the rural community of Banco,  Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, rice, "niébé" (a local grain), Bambera peas, and peanuts. They are on their first collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this first loan, FANTA, who is seated, first on the left, intends to buy farm inputs and  small agricultural material, and pay plowing expenses to maintain 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts.

After being stockpiled for a certain time, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, to a clientele composed of men and women. They expect to make an average profit of 20,000 F CFA, more or less, per season.

loans.use: to pay for labor, farm inputs and small agricultural equipment.

loans.name: Akpene

texts.fr:
Akpene est une femme âgée de 44ans, elle est mariée à un chauffeur. Elle est mère de deux.
Akpene travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2010.Elle vend du charbon de bois et du bois de chauffage. Elle achète aussi bien à Atakpamé qu’à Anié.Elle travaille avec un employé.
Akpene a requis  son  premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter du bois de chauffage et des sacs de charbon de bois.
texts.en: Akpene is 44 years old. She is married to a driver and the mother of two children. She has been a merchant since 2010, selling charcoal and firewood. She gets her supplies both in Atakpamé and in Anié. She has hired an employee. Akpene came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy firewood and sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Elsy

texts.es: Rosa Elsy tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos y libros. Hace más de 3 años se ha dedicado en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que realiza todos los días en su comarca, le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede disponer de su tiempo y eso la hace sentirse independiente y con esperanzas de darle un futuro mejor a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poner un negocio más estable, pero por el momento se siente tranquila con su trabajo. Ella solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo lápiz labial, pintura, cremas, tratamientos, pintura de uñas polvos entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa Elsy is 37 years old and has a business in which she sells cosmetics and books. She has been selling cosmetics for more than three years and works every day in her region. Rosa enjoys her work very much because she has the time to devote to it, it allows her to be independent, and it enables her to provide a better future for her family. Her greatest wish is to have a more stable business, but at the moment she feels at peace with her work.

Rosa is requesting this loan to use as operating capital for buying lip pencils, nail polish, crèmes, treatments, powders, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase lip pencils, nail polish, crèmes, treatments, powders, and other products.

loans.name: Benkola E Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKOLA E sont des femmes mariées qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, gombo, le pois de terre et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, MAGNINI MOUTAGA, la première assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the “Benkola E” group are married women averaging 30 years of age, with two children. They live mostly in polygamous families in Baou, a village in the rural community of Banco, Dioila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali).

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with the goal of being better able to manage their activities at the beginning of the winter season. They grow, among others, rice, gumbo [okra],  ground-beans and peanuts [ground nuts]. They are on their first collaboration cycle with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this first loan, Magnini Moutago, seated first on the right in the photo, plans to purchase agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers] and small tools and pay the cost of working the field and weeding a peanut field about 0.5 ha [about 1.25 acres] in size. 

After harvesting, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Kola, Banco and N’Golobougou, to a customer base composed of both men and women. The group members expect to earn an average monthly income of 30,000 West African franks per agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, small tools and agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers]

loans.name: Egnonam

texts.fr:
Egnonam est une femme âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée à un peintre.
Egnonam travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006.elle vend de la farine de manioc, du maîs,de l’oignon,de la tomate, de l’huile d’arachide et plein d’autres choses. Elle achète à Lomé puis revend sous un apatam à Avépozo.
Egnonam a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin de renforcer son commerce.
texts.en: Egnonam is 48 years old and married to a painter. She has been a merchant since 2006, selling cassava flour, corn, onions, tomatoes, groundnut oil and many other items. She gets her supplies in Lomé and resells under an awning in Avépozo. Egnonam came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and cassava flour.

loans.name: Benkola F Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKOLA F sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt,  WARABA SEYDOU, qui la première assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour  et sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. WARABA SEYDOU compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  35 000F CFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkola F group are married women who average 33 years of age and have an average of three children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages in the rural commune of Banco, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region (Mali's second administrative region).

They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of organising their activities better at the beginning of the rainy season. They grow rice and groundnut among other things. They are on their first loan from the institution.

With this first loan, Waraba Seydou, who is sitting on the far right, is planning to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment as well as paying for labor and hoeing costs in order to maintain around half a hectar of rice and groundnut.

Once the crops have been harvested, the produce is sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou, to a customer base made up of men and women. Waraba Seydou is expecting to make an average profit of around 35,000FCFA at the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizers, weedkiller, hoeing and small materials

loans.name: Abla Angèle

texts.fr:
Abla est une femme âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée à un agent commissionnaire de loto-sport.Elle a un enfant.
Abla travaille comme tresseuse et revendeuse de « sodabi « et de Louga (des bonbons faits à base d’arachides et de sucre)depuis 1998.Elle achète dans les fermes et dans les marchés de la place et revend à Avépozo .
Abla a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin de renforcer son commerce de SODABI.
texts.en: Abla is 44 years old and the mother of one child. Her husband is an agent of the football pools "Loto Sport". Abla has earned her living since 2009 by plaiting, and selling sodabi (a local alcoholic drink) and louga (candy produced from groundnuts and sugar). She buys her supplies from local farms and at neighboring markets, and resells her goods in Avépozo. Abla came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to boost her sodabi business.

loans.use: to buy sodabi.

loans.name: Benkola G Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe BENKOLA G sont des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, le pois de terre et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, ROKIA la personne assise au milieu compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. ROKIA comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35 000F CFA environs  en fin de campagne
texts.en:
The ten women of the BENKOLA  G group are married with an average age of 37, and an average of 3 children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages in the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative district of Mali. They are working with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activity at the beginning of the rainy season.

The crops they grow include rice, bambara peas and groundnuts. This is their first loan with Soro Yriiwaso. With this first loan, Rokia, seated in the middle of the photo, plans to buy inputs, small equipment and to pay for plowing and hoeing costs to maintain about 0.5 hectare of rice. After the harvest, the crops are sold at the Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou markets to customers who are both men and women. Rokia expects to make an average profit of around 35,000 CFA francs at the end of the season.

loans.use: pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, weedkiller, hoeing and small equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for making piñatas.

loans.name: Santos Eulalio

texts.es:
Santos de 45 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en la provincia de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Santos es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y a veces mango, un fruto (limón) que es consumido diariamente por los pobladores, una vez que realiza la cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su hogar.  También cría y vende ovejas y aves de corral y es otro modo de obtener más ingresos económicos.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y abastecerse de alimentos balanceados para sus animales, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.  Santos es un hombre que se preocupa por que su familia mejore y tenga algunas comodidades.
texts.en:
Santos is 45 years old and lives with his family in their own home. The only service they receive is electricity. Santos resides in the Province of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

Santos is a farmer and has his own land on which he grows lemons and occasionally mangos. Lemons are consumed on a daily basis by the local residents. As soon as his products are harvested, Santos will sell them at different markets in Piura so that he can generate income to cover the household expenses. In addition, he raises sheep and poultry as a way of earning addition revenue.

Santos is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN to buy fertilizers to improve his land, which will result in a better product. He will also stock up on balanced feed for his animals so that he can offer them to merchants at a good price. This will help improve his family’s quality of life.

Santos is a man who is concerned about his seeing his family get better and providing them with a few comforts.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his farmland and balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: La Sra. Ysabel tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales los dos mayores son independientes y el ultimo de 17 años estudia en un instituto, la Sra. Ysabel tiene su tienda grande de abarrotes la cual está ubicada en su vivienda, ya lleva en el negocio por más de 20 años; lo cual ha hecho que tenga muy buena experiencia en compra y venta de abarrotes. La Sra. Ysabel va a inventir el crédito en la compra de mercadería para su tienda, ya que tiene un stop por la gran afluencia de clientes. Su sueño principal es poder ampliar su negocio y crear nuevos rubros en ventas y así poder tener mayores ingresos y la economía familiar crezca; ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que así va a poder crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Ysabel is 52 years old, married, and has three children. Two of them are grown and independent, while the youngest is 17 years old and a student at an institute. Sra. Ysabel has a large grocery store that is located in her home. She has been in business for more than 20 years. Ysabel has gained a great deal of experience through buying and selling groceries. She will invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise for her store. A large number of customers come to her store because there is a bus stop nearby.

Her main wish is to expand her business and create new sales so that she can earn more income and improve the family finances. Ysabel is grateful for the loan that has been provided because it will allow her to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Benkola H Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BENKOLA H sont tous des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, Y.,   la deuxième  assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne
texts.en:
The four members of Benkola H Group are married women who, on average, are 29 years old and have two children. They live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Y., the second woman sitting at the right-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.5 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 25,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una madre D. familia D. 53 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicios sólo D. luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito La Matanza que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Teresa se dedica a la venta D. cerveza y elaboración, venta D. chicha D. jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base D. maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú), esta actividad los realiza desD. hace varios años, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado D. generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas D. la chicha D. jora y cerveza en la zona donD. vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.

Teniendo la oportunidad D. crecer Teresa a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad D. cerveza y harina D. maíz para la elaboración D. chicha D. jora, con la finalidad D. obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y para que su familia se supere poco a poco.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 53-year-old mother who lives in her own home with her husband and son. The only service they receive is electricity. Teresa resides in the rural section of the District of La Matanza, which is part of the Department of Piura. All of the residents in this area engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, and making handicrafts.

Teresa sells beer and also prepares and sells “chicha D. jora” (a rich beverage maD. from corn that is widely consumed in northern Peru). She has been in this business for several years and making this beverage is a tradition that has been passed from generation to generation. Her local sales of beer and “chicha D. jora” have gone up recently. This has resulted in a favorable increase in her income and an improvement in her family’s quality of life.

With this growth opportunity, Teresa is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2500 PEN so that she can buy beer in bulk and cornmeal for making “chicha D. jora”. She hopes to generate more revenue and attract more customers so that she can repay the loan and help her family get ahead a little bit at a time.

loans.use: to purchase beer in bulk and cornmeal for making "chicha de jora".

loans.name: Shirley Del Rosario

texts.es: Shirley Del Rosario tiene 30 años, se dedica a la venta de alimentos para animales. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio. Es una persona muy conocida en su negocio pues siempre está al pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan para no perderlos. Siempre se caracteriza por brindar un buen servicio. Shirley a se levante todos los días temprano para recibir a sus clientes. Ella solicita este crédito para aprovechar esta temporada lluviosa y comprar concentrado, maíz, trigo, sorgo entre otros. Sueña con establecer un negocio mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Shirley Del Rosario is 30 years old and has been selling animal feed for more than seven years. She is well-known in her business because she is always aware of what her customers need so as not to lose sales. Shirley is always known for providing good service. She wakes up early every day so that she can attend to her customers.

Shirley is requesting this loan so that she can take advantage of the rainy season and buy concentrated feed, corn, wheat, sorghum, and other products. She dreams of establishing a much larger business.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed, corn, wheat, sorghum, and other products.

loans.name: Tsotso Alexine

texts.fr:
Alexine est âgée de 35ans. Elle est une femme mariée à un informaticien. Elle est mère de 02 enfants.
Alexine travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle vend des produits génériques et pour cela s’approvisionne à Lomé au grand marché.
Alexine a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits génériques.
texts.en: Alexine is 35 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband is in computers. Alexine has been a merchant since 2006. She sells generic products, which she buys at the great market in Lomé. Alexine came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy generic products.

loans.use: to buy generic products.

loans.name: Sonata En Invierno Group

texts.es:
Carla es integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal “Sonata en Invierno” la cual tiene el cargo D. secretaria y está conformada por 07 mujeres emprendedoras y responsables.
Carla tiene 32 años D. edad y su familia está conformada por ella su conyugue y 03 hijos que en la actualidad dependen D. ellos. Carla se dedica a la venta D. helados la cual lleva 8 años dedicándose en dicha actividad,  es así como Carla poco a poco ha podido surgir, también nos cuenta que alquilan autos  donD. tiene un ingreso mas para su hogar, ella empezó con 01 auto pero con el buen uso  que le dio a sus ingresos y   con la ayuda D. su conyugue lograron superarse, contando en la actualidad con 3 autos. A futuro a Carla le gustaría instalar su propio negocio donD. brinD. ensaladas D. fruta. Con el préstamo solicitado va usar para el mantenimiento D. los autos, comprando aceite, filtros, llantas. La Alcancía Comunal “Sonata en Invierno” agradece la confianza. En la fotografía  vemos a una integrante pasiva  la señora Zoraida que en el próximo ciclo se va a reincorporar, ella es la que esta D. chompa rosada.
texts.en:
Carla is a member of the Communal Bank “Sonata en Invierno” (Sonata in Winter) in which she serves in the position of secretary. The group is composed of seven enterprising and responsible women.

Carla is 32 years old and her family consists of her husband and three children who are dependent on her. She has been selling ice cream for eight years and has achieved gradual success. In addition, Carla says that she rents out automobiles to earn more household income. She started out with one car and it became a good investment that generated income which enabled her to help her husband push forward. Now she has three vehicles. In the future, Carla would like to have her own business where she sells fruit salad. With the loan she requested, Carla plans to pay for maintenance of her automobiles and buy oil, filters, and tires.

The “Sonata en Invierno” Communal Bank is grateful for the trust that has been shown to them. In the photograph, there is a woman wearing a pink sweater named Sra. Zoraida. She is an inactive member and will be rejoining the group in the next loan cycle.

loans.use: to purchase oil, filters, and tires for her fleet of rental vehicles.

loans.name: Xochilt Maria

texts.es: Xochilt Maria es una persona muy emprendedora y se siente muy feliz. Su actividad es la venta de cerámica disfruta de realizar este tipo de actividad. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para mejorar su negocio la mayoría de sus clientes saben que ofrece muy buenos servicios, pues siempre esta preocupándose por satisfacer la demanda. El crédito es para la compra de azulejos de porcelana, cuadros, ladrillos, entre otros productos  pues actualmente tiene bastante demanda.
texts.en:
Xochilt Maria is a cheerful and enterprising individual. She sells ceramic tiling and enjoys being in this type of business. This is not the first time she has received financing in order to improve her business. Most of her customers know her because she offers good service. Xochilt Maria is always concerned about being able to meet the demand.

This loan will be used to buy porcelain tiles, frames, bricks, and other products that are currently in great demand.

loans.use: to purchase porcelain tiles, frames, bricks, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to develop his vetrinary clinic

loans.name: Abat Manuel

texts.es:
Abat de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en edad escolar en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Guadalupe que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Desde algunos años Abat se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra (productos reciclables)al por mayor y menor, actividad que actualmente se a incrementado por su rentabilidad, también cuenta con una moto con la que se ayuda para llevar la chatarra que recolecta durante todo el día en la zona donde vive y con los ingresos que adquiera podrá cubrir sus obligaciones familiares.

Para poder seguir realizando la misma actividad ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para seguir comprando chatarra (productos reciclables)y realizar algunos arreglos a su moto de carga que está presentando algunas fallas mecánicas.  Abat es una persona responsable y trabajadora que lo único que desea es que su familia se supere y salga adelante.
texts.en:
Abat is 39 years old.  He lives with his wife and school age children in their own house.  Their house has electricity and water services and is located in the Guadalupe district in the department of La Libertad.  This area is characterized by agricultural and livestock activities and tourism.  

Some years ago Abat started buying and selling scrap metal (recyclable products) wholesale and retail, an activity that is currently increasing in profitability.  He also has a motorcycle that he uses to transport the scrap metal that he collects during the day in the area where he lives.  With the income he earns he is able to cover his family's expenses.  

In order to continue with this activity he has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] through Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use the loan to buy scrap metal (recyclable products) and make repairs to his motorcycle as it is having mechanical problems.  Abat is a responsible and hard-working person.  The only thing he wants is for his family to excel and get ahead.

loans.use: purchase more scarp metal and make repairs to his motorcycle.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer, de 31 años, convive con Aidé. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Alexander, Lesly y July. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). La siembra de café, plátanos y palta, son los principales sembríos de Wilmer, los cuales fertiliza, cuida y cultiva constantemente, en su hectárea de terreno agrícola. Ya tiene 11 años dedicándose a la agricultura, y lo que más le gusta a él, es poder solucionar los constantes problemas que se presentan en el periodo del sembrío, según recuerda que hace algún tiempo la maleza que crecía entre sus cultivos afectaron su crecimiento. Por ello, Wilmer, ya comenzó a hacer viveros de café, comenzando con 3 mil plantas; con ello piensa renovar sus plantaciones, y de esa manera tener plantas nuevas y fuertes posteriormente. Además de trabajar en sus tiempos libres en una hacienda agrícola, donde producen café y diferentes frutos oriundos de la zona, ahí espera obtener un dinero extra para su hogar. Él pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde adquiere nuevas experiencias y nuevos éxitos con el trabajo conjunto que realizará en está nueva constitución de su banco comunal. Razón por la que se compromete en pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Wilmer de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para distribuirlos entre sus diferentes sembríos y así obtener buena producción.
texts.en:
Wilmer, 31, lives with Aidé.  They have three children together: Alexander, Lesly and July.  They live together as a family in their own house located in Unión Popular (Peruvian Central Jungle).  

Wilmer’s main activity is growing coffee, bananas and avocados which he fertilizes and cares for constantly on his one hectare of farmland.  He’s been in this line of work for 11 years now and what he most enjoys is solving the constant problems that crop up during the growing season.  As he recalls, weeds growing among his crops affected their growth.  Because of this, Wilmer has started to build coffee nurseries, starting with 3000 plants, that he plans to use to rejuvenate his plantations to have new, strong plants later on.  He also works in his free time on a large farming estate where coffee and various local fruits are produced; he expects to earn extra money for his household there.

He is a member of the “La Unión Hace la Fuerza” (Unity Makes Strength) communal bank and this is the second MFP loan where he’s getting new experiences and new successes working as a team that will take place in this new communal bank makeup.  Because of this, he pledges to make his installment payments in a punctual way.  

If Wilmer were to receive your support, he will use the requested funds to buy several sacks of natural fertilizer to spread among his various crops to thus obtain a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es una madre de familia de 46 años, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona tiene como principal actividad el comercio,la crianza de aves de corral y turismo.  

Celia se dedica  a la venta de frutas y verduras en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de la zona donde vive, con una experiencia de 5 años , es por eso que es conocida y tiene su propia clientela,  las ventas de sus productos se han ido incrementando; al igual que sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

El préstamo que solicitó a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla fue de 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo va utilizar  para realizar algunas mejoras en su casa (como colocar puerta y ventanas de fierro) para que tenga mayor seguridad en su domicilio, el aumento de sus ventas le permitirá cubrir su crédito y cumplir con sus obligaciones de casa.  Celia es una persona con muchos aspiraciones y uno de ellos es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo pueda tener un  puesto fijo en el mercado y contar con más comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Celia is a 46-year-old mother living with her children in her own house that has all basic utilities located in José Leandro Ortiz District that belongs to Chiclayo Province.  This zone’s main activity is commerce, barnyard fowl raising and tourism.

Celia is a fruit and vegetable street vendor in her local market.  She has 5 years’ experience so is well knows and has her own clientele.  Sales have been increasing as well as her income to improve her family’s quality of life.

The loan she requested from Edpyme Alternativa through their Capital Seed program was for 2000 new soles which she’ll use to do some home improvements (like installing metal doors and windows) so that her house will be safer.  Increased sales will allow her to repay the loan and meet household expenses.  Celia is a person with many hopes.  One of them is that she’ll be able to install a fixed sales stand in the market and have comforts at home thanks to her work and effort.

loans.use: to install windows and metal doors on her house.

loans.name: Mauro Jesus

texts.es:
Mauro de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican específicamente al comercio y crianza de aves de corral.

Mauro  maneja su propia mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace algunos años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, a pesar de la gran competencia que existe realizando el mismo trabajo, el trata en lo posible desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades de su hogar.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento y renovación de llantas y carpa que necesita su mototaxi para seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Mauro es una persona que con esfuerzo y trabajador  desea que sus hijos tengan un mejor nivel de vida en un futuro.
texts.en:
Mauro, 51, lives with his wife and children in his own home, which has the basic utilities of water and electricity.  He lives in an urban area of the José Leonardo Ortiz district, which is in Chiclayo province.  The residents of this area tend to work raising poultry and in retail trade.

Mauro has had his own mototaxi (a light vehicle used to move a maximum of 3 people short distances) for several years.  He works in the same neighborhood where he lives.  In spite of all of the competitors in this same line of work, he tries as hard as possible to transport a good quantity of passengers to their various destinations starting in the early morning.  In this way, he can have a higher income to pay for the household expenses and necessities.

Mauro has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles, which he will use to maintain and replace his tires and the canopy of his mototaxi.  He needs these items to continue to provide good service to his customers and improve the quality of life of his family.  Mauro is a person who, with hard work and effort, wants his children to have a better standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to maintain/replace the tires and canopy of his mototaxi

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda, de 56 años, está casada con Jesús. Ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Eden y César. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Está pareja de esposos, a pesar de su avanzada edad, siguen unidos, y sobre todo trabajando mucho, para sacar a delante a sus dos últimos hijos. Hace 16 años que se dedican a la agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de café, palta y plátanos. Erlinda nos cuenta que ambos coordinan para poder vender sus sembríos, mientras que ella lleva a vender al mercado central de La Merced, los plátanos que cada 15 días cosecha, su esposo Jesús, comercializa, su grano de café en la cooperativa de Alto Palomar. Todo el esfuerzo que realizaron en estos años, lograron que ahora, obtengan más de 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, que le producen el sustento económico para su familia. Los planes de esta pareja es incrementar la calidad y cantidad de sus cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está segura que logrará sus objetivos con su apoyo y de los integrantes de su asociación. Razón por la que se compromete en pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Erlinda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para podar la maleza que crece entre sus cultivos, para ello contratará peones; asimismo comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para nutrir sus sembríos de café.
texts.en:
Erlinda, 56, is married to Jesús.  They have nine children together but only two still live with them: Edén and César.  They live together as a family in their own house located in Unión Popular (Peruvian Central Jungle).  This couple, despite their advanced age, continues together and, above all, working very hard to raise their last two children.  

They’ve been farming for the last 16 years; their main crops are coffee, avocados and bananas.  Erlinda tells us that they both coordinate to sell their entire crops. While she goes to La Merced Central Market to sell bananas that are harvested every two weeks her husband, Jesús, sells the coffee beans at the Alto Palomar Cooperative.  All the effort they’ve expended over the years has led to their now having more than 3 hectares of farmland that produce their family’s support.  The couple’s plan is to increase both the quality and the quantity of their crops.

She belongs to the “La Unión Hace la Fuerza” (Unity Makes Strength) communal bank and this is the second MFP loan where she’s sure she’ll meet her goals with help from her association’s members.  Because of this, she commits to make her installment payments punctually.

If Erlinda were to receive your support, she will use the requested money to buy tools to remove the weeds that grow among her plants and to do so she’ll hire farmhands.  She will also buy several sacks of natural fertilizer to nourish her coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and to hire farm hands.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Tomas se dedica desde hace 10 años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento ideal lo puedan ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar los gastos diarios de su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar de otras especies de animales para seguir comercializandolos a sus clientes , con la finalidad de que obtenga  mejores ganancias y así pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Tomas es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
Tomas, 51, lives with his wife and children in his own home.  The only utility they have in the home is electricity; their home is located in the Morrope district of the department of Lambayeque.  This is an area known for its livestock, agricultural and handicraft production.  

Tomas has been raising and selling pigs for 10 years.  His corral is located at the back of his house.  He feeds them with nutritionally balanced feed, and once they grow to an ideal size he offers them for sale to his customers.  With the income he derives from this activity he is able to cover the daily household expenses.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy another species of animal to sell to his customers, with the objective of obtaining better earnings and having a better quality of life.  Tomas is a hardworking and responsible person who only wants the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy animals other than pigs to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jhans

texts.es: Jhans, de 25 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador, que hace poco se independizo, pues ya alquilo un cuarto propio en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana), donde vive. Esté joven y emprendedor hombre se dedica a varias actividades durante el día. Desde niño comenzó con la siembra de plátanos en una hectárea, mientras que en la otra hectárea siembra un poco de café. Según cuenta cada 15 días cosecha plátanos, ya tiene dos años dedicándose a la agricultura, y asegura que gracias a Dios pudo vender a muy buen precio sus cultivos; pues los vendedores de la cooperativa de Sanchirio, reconocen el buen grano de café, que heredo de su papá Luis, de 45 años; pero sigue mejorando sus cultivos con la ayuda de su hermano Edwin, quien es su socio. Por todo lo que aprendió en está temporada, Jhans, desea seguir sembrando, pero sin descuidar su negocio de elaboración de panes; los que elabora durante el día. Le va muy bien, ya todos lo conocen y comprar sus ricos panes; por ello está pensando abrir una panadería en el futuro. Él pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está seguro de salir adelante en la realización de sus objetivos. Pues su asociación está conformada por personas responsables y trabajadoras. Jhans de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los ricos panes, que solo él sabe preparar.
texts.en:
Jhans, 25, is a single, hardworking man who recently became independent because he leased a room of his own in Unión Popular (Peruvian Central Jungle) where he lives.  This young, enterprising man does several activities during the day.  Since childhood he’s worked farming bananas on a hectare of land while growing some coffee on the other hectare.  According to him, he harvests bananas every two weeks.  He’s been farming for two years now and assures that, thanks be to God, he was able to sell his crops for very good prices because the sellers at the Sanchirio Cooperative recognize the good coffee beans that he inherited from his father, Luis, 45, but that he continues to improve with help from his brother, Edwin, who is his partner.

Because of everything he’s learned this season, Jhans wants to continue planting but without neglecting his bread making business, which he does during the day.  He does very well.  Everyone knows him and buys his delicious bread.  Because of this he plans to open a bakery in the future.

He belongs to the “La Unión Hace la Fuerza” (Unity Makes Strength) communal bank and this is the second MFP loan where he’s sure to reach his objectives because the association is composed of responsible, hardworking people.  

If Jhans were to receive your support, he will use the requested money to buy ingredients needed to manufacture the delicious bread that only he knows how to make.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to bake more bread.

loans.name: Aldo Omar

texts.es:
Aldo de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, no tiene hijos todavía, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican específicamente al comercio, crianza de aves de corral y turismo.

Aldo  maneja su propia mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace algunos años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, a pesar de la gran competencia que existe realizando el mismo trabajo, el trata en lo posible desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades diarias de su casa.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2600 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi y para cubrir algunos gastos personales, al no tener fallas  podrá seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Aldo es una persona trabajadora y responsable que desea que su esposatenga las comodidades necesarias en su casa.
texts.en:
Aldo, 51, lives with his wife in his own home.  He has no children.  His house has all the basic utilities, and is located in an urban neighborhood of Chiclayo province.  The residents of this area tend to work raising poultry, and in retail trade and tourism.

Aldo has had his own mototaxi (a light vehicle used to move a maximum of 3 people short distances) for several years.  He provides mototaxi service in the same neighborhood where he lives.  In spite of the significant competition in this line of work, he tries as hard as possible to move a large quantity of people to their various destinations, starting in the early morning hours.  In this way, he can have a higher income to pay for the household expenses and necessities.

The loan he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa is for 2,600 Peruvian soles, and it will be used to maintain his mototaxi and to cover some personal expenses.  This way he will not fail to keep providing good service to his customers and improve his quality of life.  Aldo is a hardworking and responsible person who wants his wife to have all of the comforts she needs in the home.

loans.use: to maintain his mototaxi and cover some personal expenses

loans.name: Francisco Enrique

texts.es: Francisco  tiene 56 años, es casado y reside junto a su esposa. Se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de soldadura, el tiene varios clientes que llegan a solicitarle los diferentes servicios que ofrece, la ubicación de su negocio es en el barrio san Agustín este negocio le brinda los ingresos que necesita para sacar adelante la economía de su familia. En esta oportunidad él se encuentra trabajando arduamente para tener éxito en su actividad. Francisco se encuentra solicitando un crédito que planea invertir en la compra de hierro, aluminio, estaño, plomo entre otros.
texts.en: Francisco is 56 years old, married and lives with his wife. He provides a welding service and has several clients who come to him for the different services offered. His business is located in the neighborhood of San Agustín.  This business provides the income needed to improve his family's economical situation.  On this occasion, he is working hard to succeed in business.  Francisco is requesting a loan that he plans to invest in the purchase of iron, aluminum, tin, lead etc.

loans.use: to buy iron, aluminum, tin, and lead.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, de 44 años, convive con Luis, su esposo. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo vive con tres de ellos: Martín, Rosario y Luis. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). La constancia y el esfuerza de está pareja, hicieron que obtengan 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. María, se esfuerza mucho por mantener la unión familiar y apoyar en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos a su esposo Luis, quien afirma que desde que consolidaron una familia, hace ya 21 años; comenzaron a sembrar café y plátanos; hasta hoy el apoyo que obtiene de ella, lo motiva, “ella es muy hábil para la venta”, asegura. María, después de cada cosecha, comercializa su fruto de plátanos en la ciudad de La Merced, pero su grano de café los vende en la cooperativa de que formaron en la comunidad de Alto Palomar, Pero como socios, María, está feliz de poder tener el apoyo constante de su esposo, juntos desean trabajar con ahínco para la mejora de sus sembríos, y de esa manera incrementar su producción. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para continuar con sus planes. Asimismo se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. María de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para fortificar su vivero de café.
texts.en:
María, 44, lives with her husband, Luis. They have six children together but they only live with three of them: Martín, Rosario and Luis. They live as a united family in their own house, located in the locality of Unión Palomar (in the central Peruvian jungle). The effort and constancy of this couple has allowed them to obtain three hectares of agricultural land. María works very hard to maintain their family unity and to support her husband, Luis, with caring for the crops. Luis affirms that it has been 21 years since they started a family

They started planting coffee and bananas. To this day, Luis is motivated by the support he receives from María. "She is very good at sales," he says. After the harvest, María sells their bananas in the city of La Merced. Their coffee, on the other hand, they sell as members of a cooperative formed in the community of Alto Palomar. María is pleased to have the constant support of her husband. They hope to work hard together to improve their crops and thereby increase their production.

She belongs to the “La Unión Hace la Fuerza del Palomar” ["Unity Makes Palomar Strong"] communal bank and this is her second loan through Microfinanzas Prisma. She hopes for a small loan to continue with her plans. She also promises to make her repayments punctually. When María receives her loan, she will use the money to purchase several sacks of natural fertilizers to strengthen her coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of natural fertilizer

loans.name: Katia Iveth

texts.es:
Katia de 20 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Castilla que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Katia se dedica a la venta de ropa, a colocado un bazar donde ofrece todo tipo de productos para el uso diario en su domicilio, desde hace 5 año, también trae a pedido la ropa, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para implementar comprando otro tipo de mercadería como productos de primera necesidad, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando en su bazar para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida, para seguir apoyando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Katia, 20, lives with her parents.  The family house, in the Peruvian "departamento" of Piura, has electricity and running water.  Piura is a rural area and the people there work at farming, livestock-rearing and making and selling handicrafts.

Katia has owned a clothing business for 5 years.  She operates the business in an arcade where you can buy all kinds of everyday merchandise.  She also supplies clothing to order, a good way of increasing demand for the merchandise she sells and, in turn, her income.  

Her business is becoming more prosperous by the day so she's decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new soles loan to buy a wider rang of products.  She wants her customers to continue buying her merchandise so that she can improve her standard of living and go on helping her parents.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing business.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
Cirilo de 67 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pacora que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Cirilo desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias con la finalidad de solventar sus gastos diarios de su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales como aves de corral y su respectivo alimento, con los ingresos que obtenga pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Cirilo es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su esposa tenga algunas comodidades.
texts.en:
Cirilo, 67, lives with his wife.  The family house, in the Peruvian "departamento" of Lambayeque, has electricity and running water.  Lambayeque is a rural area and the people there work at farming, livestock-rearing and making and selling handicrafts.

Cirilo has made a living raising and selling sheep for many years.  He keeps them in a pen outside his house.  The pen is large and well-ordered.  He feeds the animals a balanced diet that includes pasture grass.  The diet is important for optimizing growth and for ensuring that he gets the best price for the sheep at local markets.  The more he earns, the easier he can pay his household expenses.

He is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new soles loan that he will use to buy more animals--poultry--and the feed that he needs to care for them.  He will use the extra income to repay the loan and improve his standard of living.  Cirilio is a hard-working and responsible man who only wants his wife to have a few nice things.

loans.use: to buy poultry and supplies to care for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repay a loan.

loans.name: Victor Ausberto

texts.es:
Víctor de 59 años de edad, es soltero, vive su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.  

Víctor se dedica  a la venta de frutas y verduras en un puesto en el mercado de la zona donde vive, con una experiencia de 3 años , es por eso que es conocida y tiene su propia clientela,  las ventas de sus productos se han ido incrementando; al igual que sus ingresos para sus necesidades diarias de su casa y personales.  También cría y comercializa aves de corral para poder tener otro ingreso económico.

El préstamo que solicitó a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla fue de 1000 nuevos soles, servirá para comprar más frutas y verduras para abastecer su puesto en el mercado, con el fin de satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes y también para adquirir alimentos para sus aves de corral, el aumento de sus ventas le permitirá cubrir su crédito y cumplir con sus obligaciones de su casa donde vive.  Víctor es una persona con muchos aspiraciones y uno de ellos es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo pueda tener otro  puesto en el mercado y contar con más comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Victor, 59, is single.  He lives in a house, in the Peruvian "departamento" of Lambayeque, that has electricity and running water.  Lambayeque is a rural area and the people there work at farming, livestock-rearing and tourism.

Victor has owned a fruit and vegetable business for 3 years.  He operates the business in a stall at a local market.  He's well-known and has a regular set of customer.
