She will use this loan to buy lentils, beans, peanuts, and corn, among other things. 

Her dreams are to have good health and keep working.

loans.use: to buy lentils, beans, peanuts, corn, etc.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 32 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children.

Josie has a general store business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more products for her general store.

Josie joined PMPC just this year. In the future, Josie hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 46 years old and is a married woman with two children aged 23 and 22. She is a farmer who tills a plot of land in Surallah, South Cotabato. Her husband is also a farmer.

Anabelle helps her husband cultivate their land and grow rice crops. She also runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like slippers, biscuits, coffee and various other items. Anabelle works hard to support her family.

Anabelle is now requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell. She hopes to earn better and improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es: Zenovia, D. 65 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía del menor D.  sus 5 hijos, pues el resto se independizaron y trabajan en la ciudad. En armonía familiar los dos viven en el caserío D. Cumutay. La dulce mirada D. está inocente mujer, refleja la fuerza y vitalidad que posee. A pesar D. su edad continua con la siembra D. arveja, papa, maíz y algunas verduras, y dice que le gusta mucho su labor porque trabaja al lado D. su hijo, y juntos vigilan sus cultivos todos los días con los primeros rayos del sol. Dice que la recompensa a su labor constante la observa durante la época D. cosecha, pues obtiene regulares precios en la comercialización a los mayoristas que vienen  D. la ciudad. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces cuando no les brinda un tratamiento adecuado a sus cultivos, se infectan con plagas y recuerda con tristeza como alguna  vez perdió casi toda su producción, pero con la experiencia que le dio la vida, continúa trabajando. Además D. tener 5 vacas grandes y 3 pequeñas que le proporcionan la leche con lo que hace queso. Según cuenta venD. 15 moldes a la semana, ahí obtiene una ganancia extra. Ella es muy feliz y desea seguir trabajando en el campo, el resto D. su vida. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer D. cumutay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donD. está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Zenovia D. obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. fertilizantes naturales y la contrata D. peones para que le ayuden en su próxima siembra D. arveja, papa y maíz.
texts.en: Zenovia, 65, lives in her own home with the youngest of her 5 children.  The other children are independent and work in the city.  The two live together in harmony as a family in the rural settlement of Cumutay.  The sweet gaze of this innocent woman reflects her strength and vitality.  In spite of her age, she continues to cultivate peas, potatoes, corn and some other vegetables.  She says that she likes her work because she works alongsiD. her son, and together they watch over all of their cultivations each day starting with the first rays of the sun.  She says that the reward for her constant work is seen during the harvest time, as she gets fair prices from selling to the wholesalers who come from the city.  What she doesn't like is that many times when she doesn't proviD. adequate treatments to her crops, they get infected with diseases.  She remembers with sadness that once she lost almost all of her production, but with the experience that life has given her, she keeps on working.  In addition, she has 5 large cows and 3 small ones that proviD. her with milk, which she uses to make cheese.  According to Zenovia, she sells 15 units of cheese a week to obtain extra earnings.  She is very happy and wants to continue to work in the countrysiD. for the rest of her life.  She belongs to the communal bank  “Lindo Amanecer D. Cumutay," and this is her 5th loan with MFP.  She is very grateful to everyone who has maD. this loan possible, and so she pledges to make her payments on time.  Zenovia, once she gets her loan, will purchase natural fertilizers and will hire labor to help her with her next planting of peas, potatoes and corn.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizers and to hire workers

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, de 28 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Eduardo y de su pequeño hijo Luis. En armonía familiar ellos viven en el caserío de Cumutay (sierra peruana). Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, aprendió las técnicas del cultivo ayudando en la labor a sus padres, luego cuando formo su propia familia empezó a trabajar junto a su esposo. Dice que la labor de campo es muy sacrificada, pues siembra papa y alverja en sus chacras propias, y debe vigilar sus cultivos todos los días, desde muy temprano, para cuidarlos de las plagas y las inclemencias del tiempo que muchas veces afectan y atacan sus cultivos. Ahora se encuentra sola en esta labor, ya que su esposo comenzó a trabajar como peón en la fabricación de una hidroeléctrica. Lo que le disgusta es cargar los pesados sacos de sus productos naturales, para llevarlos a comercializar hasta los mercados de la ciudad. Y como es una mujer emprendedora para más adelante tiene planeado aumentar su producción, además quiere comprar ganado vacuno para criarlo y luego venderlo a mayor precio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde promete ser puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito. Marleni de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de alverja para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Marleni, 28, lives in her own house with her husband, Eduardo, and their little boy, Luis, in familial harmony in the hamlet of Cumutay (Peruvian highlands).  Since a very young age she’s been farming.  She learned farming techniques helping her parents with their farm chores.  Then, when she formed her own family she started working alongside her husband.  She says that work in the fields is very demanding for she grows potatoes and peas on her own land and must watch over her plants daily from very early on to keep them safe from infestations and weather extremes which often affect and attach her crops.  

She’s currently doing all the work herself because her husband started working as a laborer building a hydroelectric plant.  What she dislikes is carrying the heavy sacks of her natural products to take them to market in the city.  Since she’s an enterprising woman, however, she’s planning to increase production later on and also wants to buy cattle to raise for subsequent sale at a higher price.

She’s a member of the “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay” (Beautiful Cumutay Daybreak) communal bank and this is the 9th MFP loan.  She pledges to be very punctual with her installment payments and is also very grateful to all the people who made the loan possible.  

If Marleni were to receive your support, she will invest the requested money in the purchase of a sack of pea seeds for her next planting.

loans.use: to buy a sack pea seeds.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda es una mujer de 31 años que tiene sus metas bien trazadas, vive en su casa propia con su esposo Abelardo y sus dos hermosos e inquietos hijos Verónica y Anthony. En armonía familiar ellos viven en el caserío de Cumutay. La sonrisa de está mujer, es su secreto para mantener buenos resultados. Todos los días desde muy temprano trabaja los terrenos productivos que arrienda para sembrar papa, alverja y flor de gladiolos de diferentes colores con la ayuda de algunos operarios que contrata, mientras su esposo realiza servicio de transporte público con su propio vehículo (auto). Los objetivos de Yolanda son muy claros, ella también se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de semilla de papa, esta actividad le gusta porque obtiene ingresos económicos provechosos que le permiten vivir cómodamente y pagar una adecuada educación para sus hijos en la ciudad pese a vivir a una hora con 20 minutos de distancia. Como es una mujer emprendedora y conciente de que puede alcanzar sus objetivos con perseverancia, con el tiempo anhela construir una casa en la ciudad para que sus pequeños no se cansen viajando constantemente. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo de todos ustedes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de cada una de las cuotas. Yolanda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de medio saco de semilla de alverja, que en esta temporada piensa sembrar.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 31, is a woman with very well defined goals.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Abelardo, and their two beautiful and restless children, Verónia and Anthony, in familial harmony in the hamlet of Cumutay.  This woman’s smile is her secret to obtain good results.  Every day from very early she works her fields that she leases to grow potatoes, peas and gladioli of various colors with help from a few day laborers that she hires while her husband works providing public transportation services in his own vehicle (car).  

Yolanda’s objectives are very clear.  She also is a potato seed merchant.  She likes this activity because she earns profitable income that allow her to live comfortably and pay for an adequate education in the city for her children despite living an hour and twenty minutes away from it.

As an enterprising woman who knows that she can reach her objectives with perseverance, in time she hopes to build a house in the city so that her children will not be tired out all the time from the constant travel.

She’s a member of the “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay” (Beautiful Cumutay Daybreak) communal bank and this is the 5th MFP loan.  She is grateful for all of your support and promises to be punctual with each installment payment.

If Yolanda were to receive your support she will use the requested money to buy half a sack of pea seeds that she plans to plant this season.

loans.use: to buy half a sack of pea seeds.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: Basilia, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su pareja Juan y con 5 de sus 7 hijos, pues los dos mayores trabajan independientes. Ellos viven en armonía familiar en el caserío de Cumutay. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la agricultura, siembra junto a su esposo papa, alverjas, maíz y flores de gladiolo, y aunque afirma que el trabajo debe ser muy dedicado, durante todos los días vigila con paciencia sus campos, hasta la espera de la cosecha, mientras cuida a sus animales como: vacas, toros, ovejas y cerdos. Y cuando llega el tiempo para recoger toda su buena producción observa la recompensa a todo su esfuerzo, y carga junto a sus familiares todos los pesados sacos con los productos naturales, que vende a regulares precios a los mayoristas que vienen  de la ciudad. Además le gusta mucho este; en la actualidad le permite brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Como si fuera poco también prepara y comercializa comida en la feria de la ciudad.  Y como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde promete que será muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero del crédito. Basilia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para distribuir en sus cultivos de alverja y papa de la variedad “única”; ya que hace 3 meses sembró y tienen que ser nutridos y fortificados.
texts.en:
Basilia, 46, lives in her own house with her partner, Juan and 5 of their 7 children since the two oldest work on their own.  They live in harmony in the village of Cumutay.  This hardworking woman is a farmer together with her husband.  She plants potatoes, field peas, corn and gladiolus, and  she says that they have to be very dedicated to the work and watch her fields patiently.  She waits for the harvest while caring for her animals such as: cows, bulls, sheep and pigs.  When harvest time of their good crops comes, she sees the rewards of all their effort and she and her relatives carry the heavy sacks of their products.  She sells them at competitive prices to the wholesalers who come to the city.  What she likes also is that currently the work allows her to offer her family a good quality of life.  As if it were nothing she also prepares and sells food in the city market.
And since she is an enterprising woman in the future she plans to plant more to improve her earnings.
She belongs to the communal bank “Lindo Amanacer de Cumutay” (Beautiful Dawn of Cumutay) and this is her fifth loan with MFP.  She promises to be very punctual with her payments and she is very grateful to all the people who made the financing possible.  Basilia will use the loan to buy various sacks of natural fertilizers to spread on her crops of special field peas and potatoes since she planted them three months ago and they have to be fed and fortified.

loans.use: to buy various sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a responsible mother who has engaged in rice farming for almost 40 years. She is 62 years old and has seven adult-aged children. Despite being a widow, she still has the strong faith and determination to improve the living standards of her family.

She is asking for a loan of P 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farm to improve her rice production. She believes that through patience and hard work, she can improve her production and increase her income to satisfy their basic needs and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es: Celestino, de 50 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposa Dominga y de sus 2 jóvenes hijos, que estudian. En armonía familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, y en la actualidad siembra papa, alverjas, maíz y flores de gladiolos en sus chacras. Le gusta mucho la labor de campo porque la realizan todos los miembros de su familia, aunque reconoce que la labor es sacrificada ya que debe vigilar todos sus cultivos, para que no se pierdan por las plagas o los factores climáticos adversos, de esta manera siente que su dedicación es recompensada durante el tiempo de cosecha, pues recoge toda su producción y la vende en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad a regulares precios. Además paralelamente a su labor agrícola también se dedica a la crianza de animales como vacas, toros, carneros, chanchos, que comercializa de vez en cuando en las ferias de la ciudad. Y como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, y también quiere comprar mas animales para continuar con la comercialización, ya que sabe que obtendrá generosas ganancias. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito. Además dice estar satisfecho con el desempeño de su grupo comunal porque esta integrado por personas muy responsables. Celestino de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, que esparcirá entre sus cultivos de maíz, alverja y flor de gladiolo que tiene sembrado.
texts.en:
Celestino is 50 years old. He lives in his own house in the company of his wife Dominga and their two adolescent children who are studying. They live in familial harmony in their own house located in the rural community of Cumutay. He has made a living in agriculture since he was very young. He currently plants potatoes, peas, corn and gladiolas on his farm.

He really likes working in the fields because the entire family participates. Although he does recognize the work is sometimes sacrificed because he must tend all of the crops to make sure that they are not lost to pests or adverse climatic factors. In this way he feels that this dedication is validated during the harvest season because he reaps all of his crops and sells them in the wholesale market in his city at regular prices.

In addition to his agricultural work he also makes a living raising animals like cows, bulls, rams and pigs that he sells from time to time in the city’s markets. As an enterprising man, he plans to plant a larger quantity in the future. He also wants to buy more animals to continue selling them as he knows he will make a generous income. 

He belongs to the “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay” comunal bank and this is his fifth loan with MFP. He is very appreciative of all of the people that make this loan possible. He also says that he is satisfied with performance of the communal bank because it is made up of very responsible people. Upon receiving this loan Celestino will invest in the purchase of several sacks of natural fertilizers that he will spread among the corn, pea and gladiola plants that he has sown.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy several sacks of natural fertilizer and chicken waste fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 36 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo Olo  y de sus 2 jóvenes hijos, juntos habitan en el caserío de Cumutay. Desde muy joven se dedica a las labores agrícolas, antes ayudaba a sus padres y hoy trabaja las tierras junto a su esposo. Todas las mañanas siembra papa, alverja y maíz en sus chacras propias, y le gusta despertarse muy temprano para vigilar sus campos, pues sabe que de su esfuerzo constante depende que obtenga un productiva cosecha que venderá a buenos precios a los mayoristas de la ciudad. Luego de la cosecha comercializa  todos sus productos naturales, pues sus compradores conocen de la calidad de su producción. Pero siempre trabaja pensando en sacar adelante a sus hijos, pues quiere que estudien una carrera y sean profesionales, además dice que lo más trabajoso es trasladar toda su producción para comercializarla, ya que los sacos son bastante pesados. Como es una mujer emprendedora para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, para generarse mejores ingresos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito. Razón por la que promete ser puntual en cada una de sus cuotas. Rosa  de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito su próxima siembra de papa “única”. Ahí piensa obtener una producción de 20 sacos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 36, lives in her own house with her husband, Olo, and her two young children in the Cumutay rural community.  From a very early age she has been involved in agriculture and used to help her parents.  Now she works in the fields with her husband.  Every morning they plant potatoes, peas and corn on their own cropland.  She enjoys getting up early in the morning to watch over the fields because she knows her constant efforts are necessary to have a productive harvest which she will sell for a good price to the wholesale distributors in the city.  She is always able to sell all her produce because the buyers know that the quality is good.  But she worries about her children getting ahead, since she wants them to get a good education and become professionals.  She says the hardest part of her work is transporting the produce in heavy sacks.  

She is an enterprising woman and plans to plant more crops to increase income.  She belongs to the communal bank "Lindo amanecer de Cumutay" and this is her ninth loan through MFP.  She is very grateful to everyone who is making this new loan possible and she is committed to paying it back on time.  Rosa plans to use the loan to buy several sacks of natural feritilizer so she can begin planting the "única" variety potatoes successfully.  She hopes to harvest 20 sacks.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 56 años, vive en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. En compañía de su esposa Dionicia y con el menor de sus 7 hijos, pues el resto son mayores y viven independientes. Se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, recuerda como los miembros de su comunidad se ayudaban mutualmente en sus chacras, y por eso sabe que trabajando en equipo las cosas salen mejor. En  la actualidad siembra papa y alverjas en sus chacras que son propias, junto a sus hijos mayores que le ayudan, luego de días de sacrificada labor reciben la recompensa que es una buena  producción de calidad. Como son varios los miembros de su familia no necesitan la ayuda de operarios, además dice que gracias al trabajo agrícola ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, y por eso lo considera un trabajo rentable, aunque no siempre obtiene una buena producción, por las plagas o el clima, dice que siempre se gana algo de dinero de la comercialización a los mayoristas de la ciudad. Además también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, que vende cuando se le presenta alguna dificultad. Y como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado comprar algunas cabezas de ganado, pues quiere ampliar este negocio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Razón por lo que promete pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Manuel de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de alverja y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para sus sembríos de papa “única”.
texts.en:
Manuel, 56, lives in the Cumutay rural community in his own house with his wife, Dionicia, and the youngest of seven children.  The other children are adults and live independently.  He has worked in agriculture from a very early age and remembers how the members of the community used to help each other mutually on their croplands, so he knows teamwork is important for things to work well.  Now, with the help of his oldest son, he plants potatoes and peas on his own cropland.  After days of hard work their compensation is a good quality harvest.  Since the family is quite large they do not have to hire workers and, thanks to this agricultural work, he has been able to help his children get ahead.  Therefore he considers his work to be profitable although the harvest is not always good, due to plague or bad weather; but there is always money to be made selling to the wholesale dealers in the city.  

Manuel also raises cattle in an effort to expand his business.  He belongs to the communal bank "Lindo amanecer de Cumutay" and this is his fifth loan through MFP.  He is grateful to everyone who has made this loan possible so he can continue working toward progress.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time.  Manuel plans to use the loan to buy bags of pea seeds and several sacks of natural fertilizer to plant "única" variety potatoes.

loans.use: To buy a bag of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 47 years old and is married. She has three children aged 21, 18 and 13. She lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato with her family.

Celia is engaged in farming. She grows rice crops and raises chickens. She also has coconut trees planted on her land. Celia earns about 8,000 PHP per month doing these activities.

Celia would like to request a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Celia hopes to have a steady income that can support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 29 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo Ángel y sus 2 pequeños hijos, juntos habitan en el caserío de Cumutay. Está luchadora mujer logró muchos objetivos. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, en la actualidad siembra papa, alverjas y flores de gladiolos, que cuida con esmero durante varias semanas, junto a su esposo. Le gusta mucho su labor porque dice que le permite ganar regulares ganancias que sirven para brindarle a su familia una adecuada calidad de vida, además de obtener 2 vacas, con las cuales elabora queso, para venderlos a intermediarios. El trabajo en el campo le agrada mucho, pero hace poco comenzó a vender productos naturales, que consiste en el tratamiento de enfermedades a bases de medicina natural. Ya tiene muchos clientes en su localidad y los caseríos aledaños. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado especializarse en este negocio y así ayudar a las personas que no tienen recursos para tratarse en clínicas especializadas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito. Además dice que esta muy satisfecha con el desempeño de los integrantes de su grupo comunal. Ana de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos naturales para ofrecerlas a sus clientes.
texts.en: Ana, 29, lives in her own house with her husband, Ángel, and their two small children in the Cumutay rural area.  This hard-working woman has accomplished many goals.  Her main business is farming and she grows potatoes, peas and Gladiolus flowers, which she cares for over several weeks' time with her husband.  She enjoys her work which allows her to make a regular income so she can give her family a better lifestyle.  She also has two dairy cows and makes cheese which she sells to distributors.  Although farming is something she truly enjoys, she recently began selling natural medicine to treat illnesses.  She has many customers in her area and neighboring communities.  Being very enterprising, in the future she would like to specialize in this area and help people with no income to receive treatment in specialized clinics.  She belongs to the communal bank "Lindo amanecer de Cumutay" and this is her third loan through MFP.  She is grateful to everyone who has made this loan possible and very happy to be a member of the communal bank.  Ana plans to use the loan to buy natural medicine to offer to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more natural medicine.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es: Bibiana tiene 36 años, está casada con Eduardo de 33 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Teresa del distrito de Pichari. Bibiana,  desde muy niña aprendió las labores agrícolas y los quehaceres de  la casa, actividades que sus padres le inculcaban y por ello adquirió a muy temprana edad su propio terreno agrícola para generarse su propio ingreso económico. Es así que se dedica al cultivo de cacao, café, y otros productos propios de la selva y que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado. Se siente  satisfecha con su trabajo, por que sabe que al cultivar estos productos le genera un buen Ingreso económico, y por ende puede darles a sus menores hijos una alimentación y educación adecuada. Para Bibiana  lo primordial por ahora es comprar un terreno para ampliar la siembra de plantas de cacao, por lo que asegura podrá obtener un mayor volumen en la producción de sus frutos. Este es su Primer crédito con MFP, por el que ella se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Bibiana esta agradecida con la gente de su banco comunal, por permitirla formar parte de ello. Con los 1500 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará una parcela de terreno ya que tiene como fin extender el  cultivo de café.
texts.en:
Bibiana, 36, is married to Eduardo, 33, and they have two children. They live in their own house in a community called Teresa in the district of Pichari.  Bibiana learned all about farming and taking care of the home at a very early age from her parents.  At a young age she already had her own cropland and generated her own income.  She grows cocoa, coffee and other typical products of the area which are in much demand at market.  She is satisfied with her work because she knows she can get a good income from it, thus giving her children the education and food they require.  

For Bibiana the most import thing for now is to buy more land to increase her cocoa plantation and obtain a bigger harvest.  This is her first loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time.  Bibiana is grateful to the communal bank for letting her be a member.  She plans to use the 1,500 PEN loan to buy cropland to increase her coffee production.

loans.use: To buy land.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is married and is 34 years old. She is asking a loan of PHP12,000 to build an extension to her mini-grocery. She has run her business for five years and earns PHP 6,000 monthly. She saves her profit for the education of her children. 

In the future, Rosalyn hopes to be one of the well-known merchants in their community.

loans.use: to build an extension to her mini-grocery.

loans.name: Adripina

texts.es: Adripina tiene 56 años, convive con Alejo con quien tiene 1 hijo, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Teresa del distrito D. Pichari. Perseverante y trabajadora, así es Adripina, pero cuando era niña sus padres la obligaron que solo se dedicase a los estudios. Con el pasar del tiempo se dio cuenta que las carencias económica la empujaron a determinar y tener su propio negocio, desD. entonces posee una tienda D. abarrotes, actividad que lo viene realizando durante 4 años, y hasta el momento le está yendo muy bien. Paralelo a ello, cultiva cacao, pero en pequeñas escalas D. terreno. Generalmente trabaja sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda D. su esposo, quien se encarga D. vender lo cosechado en el local central D. su comunidad.  En el futuro espera comprar terrenos para  cultivar diferentes productos y en grandes extensiones. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que Adripina una vez más se compromete en pagar sus cuotas. Adripina está contenta con los integrantes D. su banco comunal porque todos son puntuales. Con los 2000 soles que solicita, comprará variados productos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en: Adripina is 56 years old and she lives with her common-law husband Alejo, with whom she has 1 child. They live in a house of their own located in the community of Teresa in the district of Pichari. Adripina is perseverant and hardworking but when she was young her parents asked her to only attend to her studies. With the passage of time she noticed the lack of financial resources and this pushed her to make a decision to have her own business. Since then she has had a grocery store. She has been in business for 4 years and to date it has done very well. Additionally, she also cultivates cocoa but in small plots of land. Generally she works alone but at times she receives help from her husband who takes charge of selling the harvest in the central market of their community. IN the future she hopes to purchase farm land where to cultivate different products and in large quantities. This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and Adripina is once again committed to making her payments. Adripina is happy with the members of her communal group because they are punctual. With the 2000 soles that she requests will purchase various products to supply her store.

loans.use: to purchase products to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina tiene 33 años de edad, casada con Javier de 33 años, y fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Teresa del distrito de Pichari. Su único objetivo es el de: “salir adelante “, desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar mucho para ayudar a sus padres en el gasto familiar. Vendía productos que cosechaban sus padres y ganaba sus primeras propinas;  hoy tiene su propio terreno de cultivo, en donde siembra cacao, por tanto agradece a sus padres por el apoyo y las enseñanzas que le dieron. No contenta con ello, aspira en adquirir otro  terreno agrícola para poder extender la siembra de cacao. En la actualidad cuenta con el apoyo de su querido esposo y el de sus hijos, se levanta muy temprano para ir a sus campos y cuidar de las pantas de cacao. Agustina está orgullosa por la actividad al que se dedica, pues le da gusto ver su parcela limpia y libre de plaga de insectos, así se asegura que tendrá una buena producción. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Por otro lado está contenta con su banco comunal porque sus compañeros son trabajadores y cumplidos. Con los 1500 soles que solicita, comprará sacos de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en: Agustina is 33 years old and she is married to Javier, 33 years old. The fruit of their relationship is their 2 children. They live together in a house of their own located in the community of Teresa in the district of Pichari. Her only objective is "to move forward". Since she was very young she had to work very much to help her parents with the family expenses. She sold products that her parents harvested and she earned her first wages. Today she has a plot of farm land where she plants cocoa. She is thankful to her parents for their support and for the knowledge they shared with her. She is not satisfied so she aspires to acquire another plot of farm land to be able to extend her cocoa plantation. She currently enjoys the support of her beloved husband and that of her children. She starts her days very early in the morning to go to the fields and to take care of the cocoa plants. Agustina is proud of the businesses she has. She enjoys seeing her parcel of land when it's clean and free of insect plagues. This is how she ensures a good yield. This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she hopes to have the support of each one of you. She is very happy with her communal bank because her colleagues are hardworking and accomplished. With the 1500 soles she requests she will purchase sacks of organic fertilizers to fertilize her farm land.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Almeida

texts.es: Almeida tiene 24 años de edad, convive con Orlando de 27 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Teresa del distrito de Pichari. Almeida siempre le ha gustado la agricultura, ya que su éxito se dé en la  buena atención hacia sus clientes, así como también toma mucha importancia en el tema de las labores agrícolas  que lo hace con mucha dedicación y esmero. Es por ello que le resulta gratificante su negocio agrícola, en donde produce y comercializa cacao, a un precio competitivo, incluso ya tiene mucha presencia en su localidad, y los resultados en cuanto a ventas son positivas, con respecto a los años anteriores. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene que contratar a peones, para que le faciliten en la extracción de su fruto así como en el transporte hacia los centros de acopio donde son vendidos. Ella está contenta con la labor que realiza por que le genera un buen ingreso económico. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con los 1500 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará herramientas para poder realizar su trabajo agrícola.
texts.en: Almeida is 24 years old and she lives with Orlando, 27 years old, with whom she has 2 children. They live together in a house of their own located in the community of Teresa in the district of Pichari. Almeida has always loved agriculture. Success can be given through good client service and she also places a high importance in the agricultural work that she does with so much dedication and care. This is the reason why she is so grateful to her agricultural business, producing and selling cocoa at a competitive price. She also has a good presence in her community, resulting in a positive impact on the sales compare to years past. Generally she works together with her husband but in the during the harvest they have to hire farmhands to help them collect the products and to transport the products to the collection centers where they are sold. She is happy for the work that she does because it yields a good economic income. This will be her second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she hopes to have the support of each of you to help her continue her work. With the 1500 nuevos soles she will purchase tools that will help her carry out her agricultural work.

loans.use: to purchas agricultural tools.

loans.name: Kimsanhon's Group

texts.en:
Kimsanhon, 67, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Aravan, a small village in Osh region. Unfortunately, Kimsanhon is a widow. She lives with her son, who works as an electrician. Kimsanhon breeds livestock to earn an income. She has been doing this for a long time and has a great deal of experience. She earns about 4,000 KGS each month which helps her provide for her family’s daily needs.

Kimsanhon is requesting a loan to purchase more sheep. At the moment, she has three breeding sheep and would like to have more. She will also use part of her loan to finish construction on her house. In the future, Kimsanhon wants to increase the number of her livestock and improve her family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 18 años de edad, convive con Andrés de 29 años con quien tiene 1 hijo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Teresa del distrito de Pichari. Ella nos comenta con mucha satisfacción, de cómo realiza el trabajo de injertar y podar sus plantas, y que  productos debe de suministrarle para que sean fertilizadas. Es así que Ana se dedica al cultivo de cacao, producto que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado internacional y por tanto cada día que pasa se intensifica más en la siembra de este producto. Ella trabaja en sociedad con su esposo que desde que amanece hasta que anoche se dedican en sus campos agrícolas, solo así podrá obtener una buena producción. Se siente feliz con la labor que realiza ya que le llena de satisfacción por las ganancias que obtiene. Este es su primer crédito por lo que ella se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1000 soles que solicita, comprará herramientas agrícolas que le servirá para el cultivo de cacao.
texts.en: Ana is 18 years old and she lives with her 29-year old common-law husband. They have 1 child to0gether. They live together in a house of their own in the community of Teresa in the district of Pichari. With great satisfaction she tells us how she grafts and prunes her plants, something that must be done to make them fertile. This is how Ana manages her cocoa cultivation. It is a product that is highly sought out by the international market and so, every day she concentrates more in planting this product. She works together with her husband on their agricultural fields from dawn to dusk in order to have a good yield. She is happy with the work that she does because it fills her with satisfaction for the profits she earns. This is her first loan and he is committed to making her loan payments on time. With the 1000 nuevos soles that she requests she will purchase agricultural tools that will help her in their cocoa cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural tools.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Farrukh was born in Panjikent in 1981. He is an active and hardworking husband. For the past seven months, Farrukh has worked as a taxi driver. He drives a route through Panjikent-Shurcha, Navobod, and Kolkhozchiyon. During the time he has been working, he has made a good profit that he used to buy his own car the mark of “Damas.” 

Farrukh is requesting a 600 USD loan to repair his car and buy spare parts. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his taxi

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a 51-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 19 years old and her youngest is five. Celsa's husband works as a farmer and carpenter. For the past four years, Celsa has been farming rice. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Celsa sells her rice harvest and pigs at the market in her town. 

Celsa is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to be able to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Aminahon's Group

texts.en:
Aminahon is the leader of this group. She is 51 and married to a pensioner. Together they run a family business breeding livestock and reselling it at a higher price. Aminahon and her family have been doing this for a long time. 

Aminahon is requesting a loan to purchase a cow. She hopes that her loan will help to improve her business. In the future, Aminahon wants to increase the number of livestock she has, and with the profits gained from her business, she will start building a fence around her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman with a 20-year-old child. She lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. Josefina and her husband are farmers who cultivate land where they grow rice, corn, and pineapples. She also manages their sari-sari (retail) business. Josefina does her best to improve their businesses and support her family.

Josefina is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, seed and other farm inputs. She hopes that their businesses will grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seed, and farm inputs

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 62 years old and is a married woman with seven adult children. Her husband is a farmer.

Lerma is engaged in farming. She assists her husband in managing their rice farm. Lerma also manages their sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like vinegar, soy sauce, and noodles.

Lerma is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and more items to sell at her store. She hopes their farm and sari-sari store business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and more items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn is 48 years old and married. Lovelyn's spouse works as a "tricycle" driver in their village. To increase the family's income, Lovelyn engaged herself in a business of hog-raising. She has had this business for five years. She earns P 3,000 a month every time she sells her hogs. As of now, she has had two pigs to sustain. 

She is now asking for a loan of P 12,000 to buy feed, medicines and vitamins for her hogs to ensure good nutrition. Lovelyn hopes this loan will grow her operations. With good nutrition, hogs can be marketed at a higher cost and boost her profits.

In the future, Lovelyn would like to strengthen her hog-raising business to generate more income and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for farm inputs and for spare parts and maintenance of her "tricycle".

loans.name: Muharramhon's Group

texts.en:
Muharramhon is the leader of this group. She is 28 and married to a builder, whose monthly salary is 5000 soms. In order to earn money, Muharramhon provides sewing services. Eleven years ago her parents presented her with a sewing machine and since that time she has been sewing dresses. In the beginning she was working at home, but then when the number of clients increased, Muharramhon started to teach sewing to more girls. Those girls help her in running the business. 

At the moment they rent a place in the Central Market and take orders for sewing dresses there. Muharramhon’s monthly profit is 4800 soms. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds for purchasing fabrics and materials. She also wants to use some part of the loan on the purchase of a washing machine. In the future, Muharramhon wants to expand her business and wishes to open her own store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Tojidin

texts.en:
Tojidin is 44 years old and he is married with two children. His wife is a housewife and Tojidin’s business is their main source of income. He sells iodized salt in the market of “Dehkon”. He purchases his products wholesale from salt deposits which are called “Koni Namak” in the Asht region. 

Tojidin wants to expand his business and increase his working capital. For this purpose he requested a loan of 1500 USD.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy iodized salt.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 31 years old and married. She has been blessed with three children, one of whom is an infant. The older two children attend school. 

Elsie works hard to provide for the basic needs of her family. She runs a sari-sari (general merchandise) store within her community. She has been managing this business for one year, and she earns about 5,000 PHP monthly. Elsie also raises hogs and sells street foods such as hot dogs and barbecue. 

Elsie is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy groceries such as milk, sugar, canned goods, and soft drinks to add to her sari-sari store. She hopes to maintain her business so that she can save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, canned goods, and soft drinks for her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en:
Zamira is a member of this group. She is 43 and married to a constructor, whose monthly salary is 7,000 KGS. Together they have two daughters and two sons; the sons are at school and the daughters help their mom with housework. After the collapse of the USSR, Zamira got a piece of land, which she uses to grow agricultural products. She grows cotton, potatoes, and corn. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase 83 kg of mineral fertilizers. A portion of the loan will also be used to purchase 500 kg of wheat for her family's needs. In the future Zamira wants to see all her children get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and wheat

loans.name: Ulmashon's Group

texts.en:
Ulmashon is the leader of this group. She is 23 and married to a constructor, whose monthly salary is about 5,000 KGS. She and her husband have a newborn baby. Two years ago with an initial investment of 6,000 KGS, Ulmashon started to sell fruits and vegetables. From this business she earns about 250 KGS per day. This profit enabled her to improve the living conditions of her family; she repaired the house and purchased furniture. With money received from this loan she wants to purchase more fruits and vegetables for trade. With the profits gained from her business, Ulmashon wants to purchase a cow for breeding in the near future.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rohilokhon

texts.en:
Rohilokhon is an educated woman and a teacher of history. She is married and the mother of three children. Her husband works  in the Russian Federation. Rohilokhon has been running a commercial business for 12 years. She started her business from selling blinds then she went up to selling children’s and men's shoes and now she is continuing this business. She would like to expand her business and increase her working capital. For this purpose, Rohilokhon has requested a loan of 5000 TJS.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.
